programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple who live in Australia are given help looking for a property as they look to spend half of the year in Spain, while a woman is aiming to find a holiday home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: David and Pam Rowe are searching for their dream retirement home, so Spanish Property Choice line three apartments up for them to see within their 110,000 euro budget.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Warrington, where he meets Pauline and Alan Jacks, who have been trying to sell their three-bedroom property. He soon realises potential buyers may have been deterred by the dated decor, cuddly toys, tapestries and dolls dotted around the place. A few miles away, Colin Brunold has been hoping his four-bedroom family home would sell itself, but a dodgy chimney could be putting off house-hunters.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Amateur dramatics enthusiasts Ryan and Kitty kick off proceedings in Liverpool, followed by hairdresser Karen and builder Alun, and Birkenhead couple Tony and Debby.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lee and fiancee Nicky begin the competition in Bristol with an Italian-themed menu, followed by Libby and Graham, who have been married for 54 years, and lively couple Nico and Sky.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Italian family restaurant Sabatiello's in Stamford, Connecticut, where the owner's fiery temper upsets the staff and has left him more than $1million in debt. Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a mother-and-son team who have gone through 20 chefs in two years at their struggling Italian restaurant in California. The adjoining bar is a triumph, but the oldest dining establishment in town needs an overhaul if the inexperienced owners are to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: The property experts help new grandparents Geoff and Barbara Harrison choose a second home to enjoy with their growing family in Devon or in Languedoc, France.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the countryside surrounding Edinburgh helping Ian find a new home - but it soon becomes clear that he is more interested in finding the right shed for his collection of cars and tools than somewhere to lay his head. Phil Spencer is with Rogan and Jane, who suffer from chronic indecision when it comes to house hunting - and that's the least thing they need as they have to find a home fast before their first baby arrives in three months' time.(n)

programme.title: Titanic: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Investigative journalist and Titanic expert Senan Molony examines recently recovered photographs of the doomed ship, which provide fresh insight into the reasons for its sinking. The images reveal a strange mark on the hull, which may prove previously overlooked stories of a fire raging in the boiler room. This blaze may explain why the captain chose to ignore warnings of icebergs ahead and why the vessel sank so quickly after the fatal collision.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr returns with the hybrid panel quiz show, putting a comedy spin on Channel 4's long-running words-and-numbers game. This time, guest team captain David Walliams joins forces with Jonathan Ross, while Jon Richardson teams up with Joe Lycett. Isy Suttie joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley takes care of the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In the north-east of England, former pub landlord Rob McKenzie has found his own way of dealing with tenants who abandon properties and leave behind destruction and unpaid rent, while agent Caroline is new to the job and finds herself being drawn into tensions on a street in Hartlepool.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan hears more inspirational stories of how some of the richest people in the UK and from around the world made their fortunes, discovering tales of hard graft, bizarre businesses and plucky entrepreneurship. the latest edition, the Canadian comedian meets a 22-year-old millionaire poker player, goes on a house hunt with former Big Brother contestant Aisleyne Horgan-Wallace, who is now a property mogul, and hangs out with a billionaire interior designer who has many celebrity clients.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Expensive Food
programme.desc: The conclusion of the documentary following the companies who cater to Britain's super-rich clients examines how competition for the attention of the mega-wealthy is driving innovation. Suppliers must deliver more than just food as their customers have already eaten in all the best restaurants, meaning it's the exclusivity of the dining experience that counts and the story behind the ingredients that matters.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The documentary looks at how disputes and fights between neighbours are on the increase. Crewe officers Billy Elliot and Greg Greaves help a man who claims someone else has moved into his flat while he was on holiday, while in Warrington, PC Jon Tetlow investigates reports of a man frightening children. A background check reveals numerous reports of problems between the man and his neighbours, so police have to act quickly before locals take matters into their own hands.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Clinton Dall from West Sussex, a self-made businessman and father of four aiming to build one of the largest homes ever featured on the show. Dall wants the end project to be perfect - from the finish of his mirrored cruciform steel columns, to how the floor tiles line up with the dining room table, and is willing to spend whatever it takes to achieve his vision. However, the construction represents a huge risk, as down one road lies abject failure and financial ruin, while down the other, is the creation of something sublime and almost heroic.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Food
programme.desc: Kenyan chef Kiran Jethwa travels to the Nepalese Himalayas, where he joins local honey hunters as they trek into the surrounding valleys in search of a hive.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A woman searches for a new home in Alicante, Spain, with a budget of 120,000 euros, while Daniel and Margaret from Glasgow look for a property near to the coast in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve try to find a buyer for financial adviser Ray and his girlfriend Eve, while Casas Manuel is helping Brian and Esther from Glasgow to find a home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps Pauline and her daughter Rebecca sell their run-down semi in Braunstone Town, Leicestershire.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Joe DiDomizio, CEO of travel retailer Hudson Group, goes undercover to ensure the company is fighting fit for the future. The businessman hopes to find that the company's vow to be `the traveller's best friend' is being upheld by his employees.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The cooking contest moves to Lincolnshire, with former soldier Scott and partner Clare kicking off the week, followed by Su and Dylan, and ending with ex-army couple Adele and Dave.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, married couple Karen and Nigel kick off the competition with a Bajan-themed menu, followed by Beth and Clem's meal, and Jo and Charlie's Greek night.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of Anthony Trobiano, whose restaurant in Great Neck, New York, is failing even though his partner's parents have given him their life savings and he has taken out half a million dollars in loans. Gordon has some harsh criticism about the unhygienic kitchen and the quality of the food being served, but the owner has trouble accepting his advice.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to West Nyack, New York, to come to the aid of a family-run Mexican restaurant that is suffering a financial crisis, and a case of hard-headed patriarchy. When the chef arrives he finds himself turfing out the existing customers for their own safety due to a cockroach infestation on the premises.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kent couple Chris and Sue, who are struggling to decide whether to downsize locally in Royal Tunbridge Wells, or make a completely new start in life by moving to the south of France. With this in mind, she demonstrates what their budget could buy them on the Cote d'Azur.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: The Victorian category comes into focus as Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present more building restorations in the running for the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors' Restoration of the Year award. Anna explores Mount Stewart, an imposing country house in Northern Ireland, and Wilton's Music Hall in east London. Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle visits the Pump House in Barry, Wales, and historic building surveyor Marianne Suhr looks round a medieval-style castle in Stornoway in the Scottish Highlands. At the end of the programme, it is revealed which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Stomp, a 13-year-old male okapi, is being encouraged to mate with younger female K'Tusha. But on his first attempt, he snaps his horn and causes K'Tusha a minor injury. Cameras at Chester Zoo also follow African painted dogs as they compete to be pack leader, and Raja the Bornean river turtle meets two prospective mates.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Long-distance lorry driver Neil, 52, has fallen backwards off a ramp onto a concrete floor and is sent for an urgent CT scan, the results of which are a shock. Also receiving treatments are 29-year-old Ben, who has dislocated his shoulder in a cycling accident, and Wendy, 73, who is in resus with a severe open ankle fracture after falling at home.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-year-old Chris is admitted after sustaining a potentially life-threatening wound during a game with his friend Jack, who fired the inside shaft of a ballpoint pen into his abdomen using an air rifle. College student Lennon has injured his head after jumping into a door frame while kicking a balloon, while 74-year-old Stafford arrives at A&E because his internal cardiac defibrillator keeps shocking him.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Kerry's secret is accidentally broadcast to the whole school, and both she and Bridget question Cate's motives for taking the job as school nurse - but Rory is pleased that she will be on hand to rescue him from a bully.(n)

Animated adventure, with the voices of Freddie Highmore, Antonio Banderas and Saoirse Ronan.(n)

The series follows each case as it unfolds, recording the thoughts and feelings on both sides, the process of repossession and the impact it has on all involved.(n)

programme.desc: Justin enlists Raffy and Ellie to clean Phoebe's house, while Olivia reopens the diner with assistance from Matt, Evelyn and Scott, but finds herself torn when Hunter helps out.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.sub-title: I Know What You Did Last Competition.
programme.desc: The hostility between Abby and Kelly continues, and the latter's daughters are put on probation. Meanwhile, Melissa comes to terms with a cheating scandal.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: Couples planning the perfect wedding on benefits, including Middlesbrough couple Ellie and John, who are young and in love but out of work. John is eager to give his fiancee the white wedding she craves - but is such a thing possible on benefits? The programme also catches up with Michelle and Steven from Plymouth, who recently celebrated their first anniversary. Both too overweight to work, they continue their attempts to diet while living off the state. Plus, the story of Joanna and Andrew from Cwmbran, who combined all their benefits with a loan to pay for their wedding, which was shown live on Channel 5 in the summer of 2015.(n)

programme.title: Emerald City
programme.desc: As the Wizard arrives in the Kingdom of Ev, Dorothy and Lucas find themselves on opposite sides. Meanwhile, the Witch of the West raises an army to take on the Wizard.(n)

programme.title: Sex Pod
programme.desc: Jess, Kiefer and Chloe are among the latest contributors to the show exploring sexuality, and all seek advice about their respective problems in the bedroom department.(n)

programme.title: One Night With My Ex
programme.desc: Three lively sets of former couples spend one night together alone in a luxury apartment, and decide if they should get back together or continue to go their separate ways for good. This episode sees former partners Matt and Emma, Ronan and Nick, and Imogen and Ben confront their pasts and get to the heart of the issues in their previous relationships together.(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Though chef Kate Armstrong's Type A personality serves her well when whipping up meals in the trendy Manhattan eatery where she has made a name for herself, it threatens to sink her when she is named as the guardian of her nine-year-old niece Zoe. To complicate matters, an impetuous new sous chef named Nick Palmer has recently joined the kitchen staff and his freewheeling personality seems to stand in direct opposition to Kate's unwavering perfectionism. Irish Televsion Premiere (S)(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: Edie Falco and Angela Basset head the outstanding ensemble cast in this keenly drawn character study. Set in a northern Florida coastal town, it's the tale of an engaging collection of locals and their reactions to the arrival of real-estate developers who want a piece of their paradise.Timothy Hutton, Bill Cobbs. Written and directed by John Sayles(n)

programme.title: Remember the Titans
programme.desc: The appointment of black coach Herman Boone to a high school in 70s Virginia causes a stir in the town, where white coach Yoast is well-respected. Boone walks into a minefield of bigotry but his fair-minded approach gradually wins the hearts of his players. A tub-thumping, passionate tale based on a true story(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: The Barden Bellas are back, determined to enter (and win) an international competition - one that has never had an American winner. After a disasterous performance elsewhere, the Bellas have much more to prove if they want to become the best!(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Touching, tragic romantic drama with Keanu Reeves and Charlize Theron who fall in love with only a short amount of time to spend together(n)

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: Action. When a young warrior in sixteenth-century Scotland fails to die from a fatal wound, he is banished from his clan, but later learns that he is part of an immortal race. Centuries later in New York he must fight his ultimate enemy to become the last of his kind(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: (1987) Oliver Stone's morality tale stars Charlie Sheen as Bud Fox, an ambitious young stockbroker, who's willing to do whatever it takes to emulate his hero, supremely wealthy financier Gordon Gekko (Michael Douglas). Bud's initial attempts to play the market honestly don't light his touchpaper to success. But, when he passes on some insider information to Gekko, his career starts to pick up pace and, as he becomes increasingly embroiled in illegal trading and financial espionage, he begins to make the money of his dreams. However, he fails to fully comprehend the true cost of his deals until one of them threatens the livelihood of his union boss father (Martin Sheen). Also starring Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp. M,W,R(n)

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind
programme.desc: Russell Crowe stars as maths genius John Nash, who finds that paranoia and schizophrenia are problems he may never solve. Acclaimed drama. Mature themes/flashing images. (2001)(136 mins)(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: A desperate mother seeks the help of a pair of priests, when her angelic daughter becomes possessed by a terrible demon. Horror(n)

programme.title: Frank Miller's Sin City
programme.desc: In this visually stunning collection of crime tales set in a noirish metropolis, a bruiser seeks the person who killed his one-night stand. Elsewhere, a cop is framed for a series of murders, and a group of prostitutes must dispose of a dead body(n)

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: Ben Affleck stars in John Frankenheimer's film as Rudy Duncan, an incarcerated small-time crook who takes on his murdered cellmate's identity when he is released from jail. Using his new identity he manages to sleep with the ex-con's raunchy penpal, but things get more dangerous as her brother, thinking Rudy is a master criminal, attempts to recruit him in a major casino heist(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller, about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick. Starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Suspecting their new house may be haunted, a distressed couple call in a pair of top paranormal experts to investigate(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A young couple are terrorized by three masked intruders at a secluded country house in this grimly efficient exercise in horror and suspense(n)

programme.title: The Wrestler
programme.desc: Mickey Rourke is a fading pro-wrestler struggling to adjust to life outside the ring in this Oscar-winning 2008 movie. Marisa Tomei co-stars(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A killer cyborg is sent from the future to kill the mother of a would-be resistance leader(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Antwone Fisher
programme.desc: Antwone Fisher, a young navy man, is forced to see a psychiatrist after a violent outburst against a fellow crewman. During the course of treatment a painful past is revealed and a new hope begins(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: Ted (voice of Seth MacFarlane) ties the knot with Tami-Lynn (Jessica Barth), and recruits his best friend John (Mark Wahlberg) as a sperm donor in order to start a family in this sequel to the comedy hit about a teddy bear come to life. Later, when the Commonwealth of Massachusetts demands that Ted appear before a judge to prove he's a real person, the frisky bear and his pal vow to fight for their civil rights. Morgan Freeman and Amanda Seyfried co-star(n)

programme.title: Riding in Cars With Boys
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore plays a teenage single mother who tries to overcome the feeling she's made the wrong choices in life(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: James Cox directs the sleazy Hollywood murder tale Wonderland, starring Val Kilmer as legendary porn star John Holmes. Using a non-linear plot structure, the film explores different perspectives of the quadruple homicide that occurred on July 1, 1981, in the Hollywood Hills. At the lowest point of his career and the height of his drug addiction, Holmes was implicated in the murders of the Wonderland gang: Ron Launius (Josh Lucas), Billy Deverell (Tim Blake Nelson), Barbara Richardson (Natasha Gregson Wagner), and Joy Miller (Janeane Garofalo). Launius' wife, Susan (Christina Applegate), was the only survivor. Led by Detective Sam Nico (Ted Levine), the police investigation reveals a dark criminal underworld surrounding Holmes, his disapproving wife, Sharon (Lisa Kudrow), and his innocent teenage girlfriend, Dawn Schiller (Kate Bosworth). Eric Bogosian stars as notorious Hollywood nightclub owner Eddie Nash. Wonderland premiered at the 2003 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Clearing
programme.desc: Dutch film producer Pieter Jan Brugge makes his directorial debut with the dramatic thriller The Clearing. Affluent executive Wayne Hayes (Robert Redford) and his lovely wife, Eileen (Helen Mirren), live in a beautiful home in Pittsburg. One day, Wayne is kidnapped by disgruntled employee Arnold Mack (Willem Dafoe). He is then held for ransom in a forest. Meanwhile, Eileen is forced to reckon with the FBI agents as they negotiate with the kidnapper. Alessandro Nivola and Melissa Sagemiller star as the two grown Hayes children. Matt Craven plays FBI Agent Ray Fuller. The Clearing premiered at the Sundance Film Festival in 2004(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: David Fincher's follow-up to Fight Club is a claustrophobic thriller starring Jodie Foster and Kirsten Stewart as a mother and daughter trapped in their new house's safe room by a gang of thieves. The housebreakers are a dynamic trio desperate to get their hands on millions of dollars' worth of bonds the previous owner left behind, and their arrival prompts divorcee Meg and 11-year-old Sarah to take refuge in the vault-like room of the title. Unfortunately for them, that's where the loot is concealed, and Fincher ramps up the tension with some exhilarating camera work as a deadly stand-off ensues(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: In this thrilling fourth installment of the "Jurassic Park" franchise, two young brothers visit an aunt who's an executive at Jurassic World, a theme park populated with genetically resurrected dinosaurs. But chaos erupts when a newly created dino escapes its enclosure, forcing the park's animal behaviorist to save the day(n)

programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Terminal Tenant.
programme.desc: A badly decomposed body is found in a bath, leading Laura to some very risque locations in a bid to catch the killer, including an erotic party. Meanwhile, the detective comes up with a new childcare system for Jake. Guest starring Sondra James, with Debra Messing and Josh Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the murder of a rare coin dealer, focusing their efforts on a millionaire who seems the most likely culprit - but Ross finds himself forced to play detective too. Sam Waterson and Jerry Orbach star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Curtis uncovers evidence of police corruption that puts the DA's office into conflict with an ambitious judge, and Briscoe comes under investigation for stealing evidence from a police lockup. Crime drama, with Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.sub-title: And Here's to You, Mrs Azrael.
programme.desc: A teenager who was recovering from a car accident becomes the apparent victim of a mercy killing, forcing Hawkes to make an emotional return to the hospital where he used to work - and reminding him why he changed his career path from surgery to criminal investigation. Forensic drama, starring Hill Harper.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs tries to find out why the agents are being forced by Homeland Security to take polygraph tests, while Tony and Jeanne are held hostage by a drug dealer. Elsewhere, Jenny returns from Europe to discover she has had a surprise visitor. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Lauren Holly.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: McNally, Peck and Diaz take to the streets, posing as prostitutes as part of a city-wide sting operation, while Nash assists detective Callaghan in investigating the murder of an unidentified teenager.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Frozen Foodie.
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of a chef who was addicted to sex after his frozen body is discovered at a processing plant. Laura heads to the restaurant where the dead man worked and realises its walk-in freezer is the scene of the crime, but the key to solving the case could lie with either the victim's colleagues or one of his partners. Starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The shooting of a sleazy retired policeman in a neighborhood notorious for prostitution leads Briscoe and Curtis to two suburban housewives who are secretly moonlighting. However, it soon becomes apparent that whoever killed the victim could have been acting in self-defence. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: First of a three-part story. The team investigates when the headless corpse of a film studio executive is found floating in a river, and her personal trainer and ex-husband soon prove likely suspects. Sam Waterston stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Flack and Stella interrogate a congressman suspected of involvement in the murder of a drag queen. Danny and Mac look into the case of an extreme sports executive found dead in a gritter used to de-ice streets, and Lindsay heads for Montana to testify against a man who killed four of her friends. Drama, starring Anna Belknap and Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy Seal is shot dead while threatening to throw himself from the top of a building. An al-Qaeda operative emerges as the main suspect, but DiNozzo thinks the killer may actually be found closer to home. Elsewhere, a rumour spreads that Abby may be about to leave NCIS for good. Michael Weatherly stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is called to examine the mysterious death of a sailor serving on a research vessel engaged in a top-secret mission. The ship proves to have been abandoned by its crew, and Ducky discovers the victim died from a highly contagious virus - putting everyone presently on board at risk. Drama, starring David McCallum, Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Lauren Holly.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team members search for a missing diabetic child who also suffers from an attachment disorder. A shocking confession from the youngster's mother leads them to a couple of known sex offenders, and the detectives face a race against time to find the kid before he falls into a coma. Meanwhile, Benson is preoccupied by a pregnancy scare. Guest starring Rosanna Arquette.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A music student is raped at gunpoint in her apartment - but although the SVU squad is quick to make an arrest, high-profile defence attorney Bayard Ellis tries to undermine prosecution evidence and damage the victim's credibility. Drama, guest starring Sofia Vassilieva.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Cragen goes undercover when a murder in Brighton Beach leads the team to a thriving mail-order bride business, and hopes to hunt down the killer. Elsewhere, the detectives expose a blackmail scam run by the Russian Mafia. Crime drama, guest starring Timothy Busfield and Izabella Miko.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: During a busy night at the station, the rookies fail to search a prisoner properly and he pulls a gun on Chris. The ensuing investigation by Internal Affairs sees the officers' behaviour scrutinised, and one of their careers could be over. Meanwhile, Andy learns a dark secret about Nick's past. Crime drama, starring Travis Milne.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Nick and Riley investigate an attack on a skydiver who was critically injured when his parachute failed to open. Meanwhile, Catherine and Greg are called to a double murder and it seems the two cases share a surprising connection. Elsewhere, Langston struggles to solve the death of a religious fanatic in the desert as Brass questions the prime suspect, one of the victim's followers. George Eads stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Hodges and Wendy attend a sci-fi convention, but the event is disrupted by the murder of a TV producer in attendance. The investigation soon highlights what can happen when a much-loved show is meddled with. Featuring cameos by the stars of genre shows, including Battlestar Galactica's Grace Park and Kate Vernon, and Babylon 5's Joshua Cox.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: Voight comes up against a younger, more violent version of himself, after retired Commander Perry asks him to help extract his cop nephew from a unit of corrupt narcotics officers. Lindsay is sent on an undercover sting, but her failure to take a drugs test compromises the operation and puts her in danger.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A janitor is found murdered, leading the team to a schizophrenic student they discover has been part of an experimental drug programme. programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac examines the death of a Base jumper seemingly killed when he hit a flock of pigeons, and discovers the victim was in a witness protection programme. Drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: As the hunt for La Grenouille intensifies, Tony's cover is blown and his car is later destroyed in an explosion, leaving the team convinced he has been killed. However, Ducky's autopsy on the body of the driver reveals it was actually someone else who died in the blast.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: Andy's romance with Callaghan becomes complicated as they disagree over how to handle a witness in a murder case. Meanwhile, the other rookies discover the shocking truth behind evidence from a fatal traffic collision.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Fateful Fire.
programme.desc: The detective is torn between solving a murderous arson case at an apartment block and baking for her twins' school's winter carnival. While Laura takes some time off to make her stall, fire investigator and Jake's ex Angela Ryan (guest star Anastasia Griffith) takes charge of the case. Comedy drama, starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of three. A witness reveals that personal trainer Newman flew to Los Angeles on the night of the murder, leading the officers to believe they have the wrong man. When blood matching the dead film studio executive's is found in their new suspect's car, they soon arrest him but their case may not be clear-cut enough to warrant a conviction. Sam Waterston stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Conclusion of a three-part story. The investigation into a movie studio boss's murder becomes further complicated when fresh evidence points to yet another suspect. Meanwhile, the ex-husband of the deceased goes to trial to face accusations of having a hand in the crime - is an innocent man about to be convicted? Sam Waterston stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Angell and Danny's search for the murderer of a security guard puts them on the trail of a master thief (guest star Nelly Furtado), who targets high-end department stores. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A childhood friend of Gibbs' dead daughter is stalked by a marine who recently returned from Iraq, and asks the agent for help. programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Fact-based tarring Julia Roberts and Albert Finney about an unsophisticated single mother who stumbles upon an environmental cover-up which eventually leads to a class action lawsuit. While working for a lawyer, she is puzzled by an old case and decides to do some research of her own. She discovers that a chemical company knowingly polluted the local area, and with the help of the lawyer launches a class action to sue the company for damages(n)

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: This touching saga follows the remarkable life of a simple, innocent man who finds himself in extraordinary, history-making situations. It features amazing special effects. The film chronicles his life from the '50s up through the '80s and is narrated by Gump. As a boy in Greenbow Alabama, the mildly retarded (a 75 IQ) and slightly crippled Forrest was the butt of childhood cruelty. His only friend was Jenny, a sexually abused child, who became the love of his life. During those thirty years Gump becomes a football star, meets George Wallace and JFK, wins the congressional medal of honor in Vietnam, meets LBJ, spends the night with the Black Panthers, becomes an international ping-pong champion, plays a role in Watergate, develops a multi-million dollar shrimp empire with a buddy, and becomes a jogging guru as he runs across the country several times. His love Jenny is on a different and self-destructive road that leads her to become a stripper, a hippy, a radical and finally a single mother. Gump always loved her unconditionally and in the end provides her with the peace she always sought(n)

The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: An authority on rare books is drawn into a confrontation with the forces of darkness in this thriller directed by Roman Polanski. Dean Corso (Johnny Depp) is a rare book broker who makes his living tracking down valuable items for rich bibliophiles. Corso is hired by Boris Balkan (Frank Langella), a millionaire New Yorker with a vast collection of occult literature and a keen interest in "The Nine Gates to the Kingdom of Shadows." Legend has it that the book was co-written by Satan in the 17th century, and only three copies are known to exist; the owner of one recently sold the book to Balkan a few days before killing himself. Balkan wants Corso to find the other two copies (one owned by a Mr. Fargas in Portugal and the other by a French collector named Kessler) and examine them to determine if they are forgeries. Corso is told to be thorough and spare no expense. He begins by visiting Liana Telfer (Lena Olin), the widow of the man who once owned Balkan's copy of the book, who has an unusually strong desire to get the book back, and confers with his friend Bernie (James Russo), who soon turns up dead, in a manner much like an illustration from the book. Corso learns that the book contains clues to a puzzle that will allow people to call up the devil, and certain people will stop at nothing to find the missing parts of the formula(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to England to work on an eerie case about an evil disturbance at a London council house(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Wesley Gibson, un hombre apocado, descubre que su padre, a quien nunca conoció y que fue recientemente asesinado, pertenecía a una sociedad secreta de asesinos. Después de que una atractiva mujer vestida de cuero lo recluta y lo hace miembro de la socieda(n)

programme.title: Species

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Tom Witzky is a regular guy whose life is turned upside down after he is hypnotised by his sister-in-law. The hypnosis unlocks a latent power that allows Tom to see glimpses of supernatural forces. Suddenly, his ordinary life is invaded with violent flashes of horrific images he cannot explain(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: An Iraq War veteran returns home after a firefight which left him in a coma and took the lives of several civilians. Soon after arriving, he is wracked with guilt and plagued by dreams of a burning man who wants something from him. After being denied treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder, he enlists the help of a psychic to help him understand, and hopefully conquer, his terrifying visions(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A disturbing videotape appears to hold the power of life and death over those who view it in this offbeat thriller. A strange videotape begins making the rounds in a town in the Pacific Northwest; it is full of bizarre and haunting images, and after watching it, many viewers receive a telephone call in which they are warned they will die in seven days. A handful of teenagers who watched the tape while spending a weekend at a cabin in the mountains scoff at the threat, but as predicted, they all die suddenly on the same night. Rachel Keller (Naomi Watts), the aunt of one of the ill-fated teens, is a journalist who has decided to investigate the matter and travels West with her young son, Aidan (David Dorfman), a troubled child who has been drawing pictures of strange and ominous visions. Rachel managed to find the cabin in the woods and watches the video herself; afterward, she receives the same phone call, and realizes she must solve the puzzle of the video and the person or persons behind it within a week. Rachel turns to her ex, Noah (Martin Henderson), an expert in video technology, who at first is convinced the story is a hoax until he digs deeper into the mystery. The Ring was adapted from a 1996 Japanese film by Hideo Nakata, which became a massive box-office success in Asia and spawned two sequels(n)

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: Director Ridley Scott spins this yarn concerning a Harlem drug kingpin (Denzel Washington) who smuggles heroin into the country by hiding it in the bodies of U.S. soldiers killed during battle in Vietnam. Meanwhile, a diamondback rattlesnake fighting an infection requires oral medication; and the Ambassador Center staff trains two cheetahs to stroll comfortably among humans on the grounds(n)

programme.title: The Zoo

programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: The Cornwall Air Ambulance rushes to a remote location where a man is having a stroke, a Warwickshire police officer cracks down on dodgy drivers, and when Isle of Man paramedics are called to help a pensioner who has fallen, they suspect he is suffering from something more serious.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties about to be auctioned in Sutton Coldfield, Kent and Suffolk, then talk to the buyers about their plans.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Enforcement officers meet a dealer who sold a potentially lethal second-hand car, and Sheriff Lawrence discovers his claimant is not the only one owed money by a building company.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Investigating the increasing number of false Facebook profiles that are fast becoming a nuisance to people's lives, a look at the fake washing powder that is actually a danger to the public, and how one man nearly lost out on his inheritance as a result of a sham will. Presented by Matt Allwright.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion meets best pals and a father and son who buy three items per team and compete to make the most profit at auction in Newbury, Brackley.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Mrs Tembe introduces her new beau, but when she makes a surprise announcement, her friends wonder if she is making the right decision, while Al and Ayesha share their family woes.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts as yesterday's contestants Nick, Waheeza and Matt return to the quiz show to continue their quest to crack the code and take home the prize money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley assists a couple searching for a home in the north Dorset countryside, and while in the area, she visits the renowned Lyme Regis Boat Building Academy.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a skip in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, including a dressing table and mirrors and an old rusty water tank.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques at Blackpool Tower Circus, where expert James Lewis discovers a glass bowl that was bought at a car-boot sale. Plus, Anita Manning gives her opinion on a diamond and pearl necklace, and Paul investigates the historical use of warhorses.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Michelle Ackerley present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Abi tries to help Ben and Jay find a new flatmate, Tina visits Shirley in prison, and Lauren goes out for dinner with Josh, who encourages her to apply for a job at his company. As alarm bells ring for one resident, another realises the severity of their situation.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.sub-title: It's Only Love If It Hurts.
programme.desc: Serena faces her demons and comes to a heart-wrenching conclusion. Meanwhile, Zosia takes action when Isaac reveals his true colours, and Mo risks her professional reputation when she goes the extra mile.(n)

programme.title: Child of Our Time
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professors Robert Winston and Tanya Byron follow the youngsters through their GCSE year to discover how the teenagers are being shaped by these unique times. In Scotland, Nathan shares how it feels growing up in an unconventional family - attitudes to his father's homosexuality have transformed in his lifetime. And in Essex, Taliesin reveals what impact his online gaming habit is having on friendships and his sleep.(n)

programme.title: The Richard Dimbleby Lecture
programme.desc: Former CIA director John O Brennan discusses the future security and stability of the world, drawing on his experience of intelligence collection and analysis and covert operations to determine how societies will protect themselves in the face of turbulent global events.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin joins a research expedition across the Galapagos Islands, the vast archipelago where evolution has proceeded at an extraordinary pace. The journey begins on the west side, home to a richly diverse wildlife scene, where Liz and the scientists journey into the clouds above the islands' tallest volcano on a hunt for the endangered pink iguana. Liz also travels to one of the most remote locations in the Galapagos in search of giant tortoises, and boards a submersible to dive for a new species.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: HMS Gannet's helicopter squadron rush to help when a man falls overboard into the icy waters of Loch Fyne, and the search is on for four missing teenagers in a dinghy in Windermere.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers confront a man who has not paid the rent he owes to a single mother, and agent Lawrence is on the trail of the £30,000 owed by a financial advisor.(n)

programme.title: A Service of Hope Following the Westminster Terror Attack
programme.desc: In the presence of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, Dan Walker presents live coverage from Westminster Abbey of a service of hope following the London terror attack two weeks ago.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Al reluctantly returns home for a memorial dedicated to his late father, where an old family friend gives him an insight into his dad's life, making him realise they have had more in common that he first thought.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts as neighbours Jane and Rosie from Newbury work together and answers questions to crack the three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a career-minded couple with a budget of £950,000 search for a home they could use for a holiday-let business in North Devon.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Witley, Surrey, including a copper hopper funnel, a bedside table and an old mirror and washstand.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques in Longleat, Wiltshire, where experts Claire Rawle and Michael Baggott pick out a selection of interesting collectibles to be sold at auction, including an amethyst and pearl brooch and an autograph album featuring a set of Beatles' signatures - but their authenticity keeps the experts guessing. The presenter also uncovers the hidden architectural gems of one of Wiltshire's most famous sons, Christopher Wren, during a trip to London.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker hosts the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Eight more competitors enter the kitchen, challenged to create their own dish using ingredients taken from the MasterChef Market, including clams, kidneys and pork chops. The cooks must choose their ingredients wisely as three of them will be sent home after this initial round. For the second challenge, the remaining five are asked to create a two-course meal to impress judges John and Gregg, and also win over some of the competition's most inspiring winners and finalists from previous years.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: The Benefits Cap: Is It Working?.
programme.desc: Following the lives of families who have lost hundreds of pounds due to benefit caps. Tens of thousands of households claiming benefits have had their payments cut as part of a new government policy, and this programme follows parents as they struggle to provide for their families and keep their homes.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Dan Walker introduces highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Chelsea v Manchester City at Stamford Bridge and Hull City v Middlesbrough at the KCOM Stadium. Chelsea were looking to move another huge step closer to winning the title as they welcomed one of their nearest rivals, while the match between the Tigers and Boro was likely to be pivotal in the battle to avoid relegation.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the show's experts offer advice on making money from an array of antique weapons and medical instruments.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: New series. Sheriffs Tommy and Craig chase money owed by a clothing manufacturer and Lawrence and Kev are on the hunt for a stables manager who the court says owes money.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades saves three items from a recycling centre in Walsall, West Midlands, including a set of six swivel chairs, a fireplace hearth and a set of coat hooks.(n)

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup and Rev Richard Coles present the final from Greenwich. At Queen's House, the artists are challenged to paint a portrait, but are not told who the subject is until the sitting begins. For the last test of the series, the painters must depict the Old Royal Naval College as seen from the Thames - and mentors Diana Ali and Pascal Anson are not on hand to help this time. Judges Lachlan Goudie, Daphne Todd and David Dibosa assess their efforts and reveal who is this series' champion. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest Super League matches, including Leeds Rhinos v Wigan Warriors at Headingley and Salford Red Devils v St Helens at the AJ Bell Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.desc: A look back at last year's tournament in Augusta, which saw England's Danny Willett win his first Major following a dramatic collapse by defending champion Jordan Spieth.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Vet Rosie treats a concussed tawny owl, while equine specialist Kerry helps a horse with a badly cut face. Meanwhile, in Fife, Adam has an emotional case on his hands when an owner suffering from a debilitating phobia discovers the dog he depends on has a worrying lump. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Kate Humble - Into the Volcano
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kate joins a team of geologists on a research expedition to the Vanuatu archipelago in the southern Pacific, beginning at Mount Yasur on the island of Tanna, one of the most active volcanos in the world. To discover whether a devastating eruption might happen, the scientists need to collect a lava bomb the minute it is hurled from the crater and while they prepare for their mission, Kate explores the island and discovers how the volcano shapes the lives, traditions and beliefs of everyone who lives in its shadow.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough's Paradise Birds
programme.desc: Among David Attenborough's life-long passions are birds of paradise, which he has tracked all over the jungles of New Guinea to film their beautiful and often bizarre displays. In this documentary, he examines how and why these creatures have captivated explorers, naturalists, artists, film-makers and even royalty, investigating the myths surrounding their discovery 500 years ago, the latest extraordinary behaviour captured on camera and the science behind their beauty. He also travels to a state-of-the art facility in Qatar that houses the largest breeding group of these birds in the world.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Thomas Plant and Christina Trevanion visit Co Kildare and Dublin, and try to uncover some hidden gems to take to auction in Wrexham.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores two Royal Worcester vases that are precious family heirlooms, along with a Cirencester village clock and a 19th-century hay press.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: St Louis to Jefferson City, Missouri.
programme.desc: New series. Michael Portillo continues his American rail journey west to Jefferson City, Missouri, following the tracks of European settlers in the 19th century. In St Louis he ascends America's monument to the Wild West, the Gateway Arch, the tallest free-standing monument in the US. On the banks of the Missouri River, the political commentator is invited aboard a replica of the original keel boat used for an historic expedition. In Washington, Missouri, Michael tries to craft a corn cob pipe, and in Jefferson City he finds an huge fortified building that served as the gaol for the entire Wild West.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: New series. The pastry contest returns in a revamped knockout format, as five teams battle to stay in the competition and make it through to the next heat. First, they are challenged to make 36 identical Moka au Cafe slices and Napoleons in just three hours, before creating a showpiece dessert inspired by the classic Peach Melba. Hosted by Angus Deayton.(n)

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: When he was 12 years old, Sharron Townsend was arrested for shooting a homeless man in the head. Now aged 14, he is facing justice. As this edition reveals, in Florida, children can be transferred to adult courts at the discretion of the State Attorney, so there is no upper limit on Sharron's sentence. Cameras also follow Jeremiah Hill, who shot a man during a gun trade when he was 13 years old. Now the justice system must decide how best to protect society.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Today is Andy's first day as a volunteer at Comfort Support Line's call centre, which offers the lonely and desperate a chance to talk about their problems. All the CSL counsellors have their own ways of dealing with clients, coping with the emotional stress and killing time between phone calls, but is Andy really prepared for what's to come? Comedy written, directed by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with Jane Horrocks.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the second half of the journey, Simon travels along the Black Sea Coast to the capital of Ankara and the Northern Highlands, witnessing first hand the aftermath of fighting in Kurdish areas and meeting a conservationist attempting to preserve the region's brown bears. He then returns to Istanbul, where he takes part in a popular TV series set in the palace of the Ottoman Sultans.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: As the series continues, harsh steps must be taken to ensure that the royal reputation is preserved. Meanwhile, flamboyant Philippe causes a stir of his own, and elsewhere, the King hopes that humiliating a suspect noble will in turn bring others to heel. Period drama depicting the infidelities and intrigues at the court of Louis XIV, during the monarch's early reign. Supported by Inside Versailles documentary shorts. Starring George Blagden, Evan Williams, Alexander Vlahos and Stuart Bowman.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Travellers to Louis XIV of France's rural palace are vulnerable targets when a dissident duke tries to pressure the young monarch to return the royal court to Paris. Meanwhile, a rich African prince suffers a curiously restrained reception. The period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of King Louis XIV continues. Supported by Inside Versailles documentary shorts. Starring George Blagden, Alexander Vlahos, Tygh Runyan, Stuart Bowman, Amira Casar and Evan Williams.(n)

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The ceramicists return to Stoke-on-Trent for week two of the ceramics challenge, with judges Keith Brymer Jones and Kate Malone setting them three more tasks to show who is best at working with clay. They begin by throwing a double-walled pot on the wheel, then for the spot test they have to create handles for a set of casserole dishes. Finally, the main challenge sees them making a large clock, which involves slab rolling large amounts of clay to shape, then raw glazing and firing them to produce what they hope will be beautiful timepieces. But for one hopeful, this will have been their last day in the contest. Host Sara Cox breaks the bad news.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for Dinner
programme.sub-title: Further Back in Time for Dinner: 1940s.
programme.desc: The Robshaws enter the 1940s and experience a decade dominated by war and entirely fuelled by rations, including powdered egg, nettles on toast and imitation brawn. They are even one family member down as Fred is evacuated to the countryside, but the war brings them together too as they share a Woolton pie in their very own Anderson shelter, the girls go dancing with Debbie and some GIs, and they all start to recognise how the family meal to bring them together in the good and bad times.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Part two of two. Paul Martin and the show's experts offer advice on making money from vintage fashion.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Enforcement officers meet a dealer who sold a potentially lethal second-hand car, and Sheriff Lawrence discovers his claimant is not the only one owed money by a building company.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a skip in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, including a dressing table and mirrors and an old rusty water tank.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Clive Mason investigates the arguments for and against BSL being taught more widely, and Memnos Costi tries out some of the latest smart phone apps making deaf lives easier.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: Mary opens her garden to host a village fete and shares her flair for turning easy dishes into spectacular crowd-pleasers, and she is visited by two brothers for a lesson in the art of making authentic Italian pizzas.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Conversations
programme.desc: Sean Curran talks to former Labour party leader Neil Kinnock about his life and political career. First shown on BBC Parliament on Sunday 24 July.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Len takes Daniel O'Donnell back to the islands of Arranmore and Owey off the coast of Co Donegal, where the singer reminisces about a childhood holiday he had there in 1968.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Actress Tamzin Outhwaite sets out to learn about her Italian roots on the maternal side of her family as a result of her fond childhood memories of big meals with relatives, antipasto and energetic conversations. Her journey begins in the heart of London's East End, where her great-grandfather Tony Gonella once ran a cafe. She visits the Isle of Man, Italy and finally Glasgow as she explores her ancestor's life, and also discovers more about her mother's father Remo Santi and his dad Adelmo.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Farm vet Richard carries out a tracheotomy to save a calf's life at Teesdale dairy farm, while in Fife, Megan investigates the cause of a guinea pig's cough and needs to remove a stick that is lodged inside a dog. Elsewhere, Steve is determined to help an abandoned elderly cat find a new home. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Kate Humble - Into the Volcano
programme.desc: Part two of two. Kate joins a team of geologists on another research expedition in the southern Pacific as they head to the island of Ambrym in the Vanuatu archipelago. There she undertakes an arduous journey to the volcanic cone Marum - which contains one of only five lava lakes on the planet - abseiling right to its heart to discover if another major eruption may be imminent. Along the way she discovers how the volcano has shaped the customs and traditions of the islanders and discovers what it really means to live each day on its slopes.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Rise of Animals
programme.sub-title: David Attenborough's Rise of Animals: Triumph of the Vertebrates: From the Seas to the Skies.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The naturalist explores the evolution of vertebrates over the past 500 million years, beginning with a look at how remarkable advances allowed primitive fish to make the radical move on to land, and then take to the skies with the advent of flight. He uses fossils of both ancient and living species combined with CGI and film to chart their journey out of the water to populate all corners of the globe.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant travel through North Wales, starting in Ruthin, Denbighshire before heading to auction in Colwyn Bay, Conwy. Christina visits Caernarfon castle, while Thomas finds out about the only ever Welsh Prime Minister David Lloyd George.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team work together to restore a clapping monkey toy, an ornate Victorian travelling treasure box, and an iconic 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey westwards across the United States, discovering the hidden pleasures of 19th-century railroad workers in Sedalia and learning more about the birthplace of ragtime. He then travels to Paola, Kansas, where he auctions livestock and dines on spare ribs, before reaching his destination in St Joseph, Missouri.(n)

programme.title: Me and My Dog: The Ultimate Contest
programme.desc: New series. Chris Packham hosts the show where dog owners and their pets compete in physical and mental challenges designed to test their ability to communicate, with trainers and canine scientists on hand to help them develop the relationship between human and animal. In the first episode, half the contestants must lead their dogs through a series of gates using verbal and physical signals, while the others must collect tennis balls in fast-flowing water. The final challenge sees the owners and dogs compete in a tethered biking challenge, to decide who has triumphed in the first stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: New series. Series following 10 strangers at turning points in their lives who are brought together to take over an Italian farm in the foothills of Mount Amiata, adjusting to the challenges of communal living in another country. In the first episode, they face the difficult tasks of bringing in a harvest of Merlot grapes and keeping the local wild boar at bay.(n)

programme.title: Jack Dee's Helpdesk
programme.desc: Jack Dee and guests Katherine Ryan, Larry Lamb, Jeremy Hardy and Andi Osho aim to help a studio audience to dispel their 'first world problems', and shed light on the dilemmas and issues relating to everyday lives.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents a look ahead to the first Major of the year, which will be held at the Augusta National in Georgia, and will see Danny Willett enter as reigning champion.(n)

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: When he was 12 years old, Sharron Townsend was arrested for shooting a homeless man in the head. Now aged 14, he is facing justice. As this edition reveals, in Florida, children can be transferred to adult courts at the discretion of the State Attorney, so there is no upper limit on Sharron's sentence. Cameras also follow Jeremiah Hill, who shot a man during a gun trade when he was 13 years old. Now the justice system must decide how best to protect society.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Anatomy
programme.desc: Dr Adam Rutherford examines the story of Andreas Vesalius, who in 1537 became the most famous anatomist in Europe. He went on to produce the first complete account of the human body and how to dissect it, and his drawings set the standard for anatomical art for centuries to come, earning him the title of `the founder of modern anatomy'.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: As Dan Snow's docudrama continues, King Harold has to take on two invasion forces. First, his brother Tostig attacks the south coast. He is repelled, but there is more to come. Later in the year, a vast Viking invasion force led by King Harald Hardrada of Norway lands in the north of England. Harold rushes to Stamford Bridge to fight for his kingdom and for his life.(n)

programme.title: How To Be A Surrealist with Philippa Perry
programme.desc: Psychotherapist Philippa Perry discovers the roots of Surrealism established in the political upheavals of 1920s Europe, and examines new ways of understanding the human psyche.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Surrealist: Desmond Morris
programme.desc: Since the 1960s, Desmond Morris has been known as a zoologist and expert on human behaviour - but the author of The Naked Ape and Manwatching has led a double life. By day, a rational scientist, writer and broadcaster with a mission to explain, and by night, a painter of dreamlike images, which mystify even Morris himself. This documentary looks at his lifelong fascination with the process and the genre.(n)

programme.title: Un Chien Andalou
programme.desc: A vintage collection of surreal and shocking images from the imaginations of Salvador Dali and Luis Bunuel. Starring Simone Mareuil, Pierre Batcheff and Jaime Miravilles.(n)

programme.title: Spike Milligan: Assorted Q
programme.desc: First of a two-part compilation of clips from the enduringly popular comedian's pioneering sketch shows from the 1970s, featuring material that ranges from the surreal and influential to the sublime. The programme also takes a fresh look at some of the star's more controversial material.(n)

programme.title: Spike Milligan: Assorted Q
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part compilation of clips from the popular comedian's irreverent sketch shows, featuring material that ranges from the surreal and influential to the sublime. The programme also takes a fresh look at some of the star's more controversial material.(n)

programme.title: How Quizzing Got Cool: TV's Brains of Britain
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell, Judith Keppel, Chris Tarrant, Mark Labbett and Nicholas Parsons help Ben Miller trace the origins of the pro-quizzers; quiz show veterans who have emerged from the crowd of quiz aficionados in recent years to achieve fame and fortune for their general knowledge prowess.(n)

programme.title: The Fight for Saturday Night
programme.desc: Former media executive Michael Grade tells a tale of skulduggery and dirty dealings as he explores how TV shows battle to win the crown for the best ratings on a Saturday night, looking at the many ways some of the most popular programmes attract viewers.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Surrealist: Desmond Morris
programme.desc: Since the 1960s, Desmond Morris has been known as a zoologist and expert on human behaviour - but the author of The Naked Ape and Manwatching has led a double life. By day, a rational scientist, writer and broadcaster with a mission to explain, and by night, a painter of dreamlike images, which mystify even Morris himself. This documentary looks at his lifelong fascination with the process and the genre.(n)

programme.title: How To Be A Surrealist with Philippa Perry
programme.desc: Psychotherapist Philippa Perry discovers the roots of Surrealism established in the political upheavals of 1920s Europe, and examines new ways of understanding the human psyche.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Anatomy
programme.desc: Dr Adam Rutherford travels to the Hague and Amsterdam to find out what inspired artists such as Rembrandt and Ruysch to create anatomical paintings in the 17th century, and learns how dissecting bodies became considered a suitable subject for art in the period.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: With the team's explorations of New Guinea drawing to a close, George McGavin visits an erupting volcano, where he encounters a rare bird that depends on the hot ash to survive. Back at the original site, Steve Backshall and Gordon Buchanan head deep into the crater and discover two new mammals - a giant rat and a tree-climbing marsupial.(n)

programme.title: The Bermuda Triangle: Beneath the Waves
programme.desc: Bruce Bernado explores the legend of the region where many planes and ships have disappeared in mysterious circumstances. Using a state-of-the-art submarine, Graham Hawkes reveals how five wrecks ended up 730ft down in the heart of the deadly expanse of water.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Exposed: Magicians, Psychics and Frauds - Storyville.
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling magician James Randi's attempts to expose supposed faith healers, fortune-tellers and psychics who have borrowed tricks from magicians to swindle the masses. The programme examines his rivalry with spoon-bending illusionist Uri Geller, as well as how he exposed evangelist Peter Popoff's use of in-ear receivers in the 1980s.(n)

programme.title: Servants: The True Story of Life Below Stairs
programme.desc: Historian Pamela Cox explores how Britain's domestic servants lived and worked in the 19th and 20th centuries, beginning by examining how the concept of service was perceived in Victorian society. She investigates the relationships between families and those they employed, discovers how power hierarchies developed, and learns why having domestic staff could pose problems for middle-class households.(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills

programme.desc: Harry's Meat and Gatsby's Fete. Eileen is thrilled when Erika wows with her reading at "The Young and the Restless." Also: Lisa Rinna hosts a barbecue, with Harry doing most of the work; Kyle throws a "Great Gatsby" bash, but Eden causes a scene when she sounds off about Kim(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills
programme.desc: Backed Into a Corner. Tensions soar at a party in Mexico as Kyle demands to know what Lisa Rinna said about Kim. Also: Eden consults her mother for advice; Erika advises Lisa Rinna to come clean; and a Mexico trip concludes with a wild boat ride and a memorable dance(n)

programme.desc: Feeding a Need. Lisa Rinna confronts Eden over "near death" accusations. Also, Lisa Vanderpump buys her son a condo; a show inspired by Kyle's childhood becomes more of a reality; and Lisa Rinna is honored with an award, but Dorit has increasing suspicions about her(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate the death of a senior navy officer on board presidential plane Air Force One. Forensic tests indicate the fatality was due to natural causes, but Abby remains convinced he was murdered. US drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US marine's parachute fails to open during a training exercise and he plunges to his death, leaving the team to determine whether he was murdered. The man had a reputation for good fortune and invariably walked away from accidents unscathed - but his luck at the poker table may have cost him dearly. Mark Harmon and David McCallum star.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dr Sloan faces an agonising dilemma while investigating the murder of an eminent plastic surgeon and ends up helping to charge the man's widow.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Matt pursues a gunslinger who has killed a priest and a sheriff.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Jamie's grandfather arrives to claim him just as Ben is arranging his final adoption.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A corporate jet crashes in the Florida Everglades, leaving only one survivor, who claims the tragedy was caused by a woman opening the plane's outer door in a bid to commit suicide. However, the team discovers his story does not add up. Drama, starring David Caruso, Kim Delaney and Khandi Alexander.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A woman is shot dead in an apartment while keeping watch on a man on a yacht in a marina, and the killer takes her camera and computer. A flash drive is recovered from the victim's baseball cap and surveillance footage on it includes images of Callen, who deduces that the pictures were taken in the days leading up to the attempt on his life and that the dead woman was the last person to see him before he was shot.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: The IMF go after a physicist who has been given the task of dissecting a fail-safe device recovered from the wreckage of a bomber deep inside Russian territory. Classic espionage drama, starring Peter Graves, Martin Landau and Peter Lupus.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: Mac and Harm try to find the cause of a fire on board a destroyer, while Admiral Chegwidden investigates the case of a veteran who has been refused a Medal of Honour because of his criminal record. David James Elliott, Catherine Bell and John M Jackson star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate the Halloween murder of a marine with a fondness for playing practical jokes. As the evidence accumulates, they begin to suspect he was killed by the exasperated victim of one of his pranks. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dr Sloan discovers the identity of the laughing-gas killer and sets a trap for him, while Jack mounts a sting operation to recover Amanda's stolen money. Detective drama, starring Dick Van Dyke.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A white supremacist group take Alex and the employees of a TV station hostage, as revenge for Walker and Trivette arresting their leader.(n)
