programme.desc: Callen and Sam meet up with former colleague Mike Renko, who is back in town on the trail of a civilian militia he thinks is responsible for the theft of anti-tank missiles from a Navy base. Their discussion is interrupted by Hetty with footage of a man being strangled at an aquarium - and the victim is identified as a lance corporal who was Renko's inside man at the group.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 303. Products include jewelry designed by a 10-year-old and a wedge pillow to allow women with large breasts to sleep comfortably on their stomachs. Also: a way to deal with missing garbage-can lids; a reinvention of "the tea experience"; an update on a peel-and-stick light-up decal for car windows(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 301. An Illinois perfume peddler; a San Francisco woman selling luxury soap; an Alabama guitar teacher who says his learning system is unique; a "Mr. Mom" from Baton Rouge, La., with accessories for blue jeans. Also: an update on a gourmet seafood business from Season 2(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 615. Dog chews made from yak and cow milk are pitched to the Sharks. Other products include colorful lipsticks that are organic; and there's an update on protein-packed nut spreads invested in by Robert and Mark during Season 4(n)

programme.title: The Partner
programme.desc: People, Process, Product, Partner. Marcus chooses the final two candidates and gives them their most important challenge yet—spending a day in his shoes—which involves assessing a struggling local business and putting together an investment plan(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 413. A couple from Boulder pitch sandals for barefoot runners; a rabbi from St. Paul presents his idea for an iPad-sound enhancer; a Miami homemaker hopes to drum up interest in her made-in-America bibs; and a father of seven from Hollywood talks up his Web site for creating personalized children's soundtracks. Also: an update on a Season 4 investment in a food truck that serves up lobster(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 519. One product has the men competing against the women. Included: whimsical plush slippers; an alternative to human sign holders; trousers and leggings that provide a butt lift; and a line of snack nuts with bold flavors. Also: an update on CordaRoys Beanbag Beds, which Lori Greiner invested in during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 527. In the Season 5 finale, a college student pitches her idea for a flat-folding, reusable storage box; an Indiana couple hope to score a deal for their reinvented cookware; two Beverly Hills moms have an app for measuring foot sizes; and a pair from Illinois present their simple solution for tying a water balloon. Also: catching up with entrepreneurs who have experienced success since coming on the show(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 616. A man from Davenport, Fla., seeks an investment in his grass delivery service for pet owners. Also: a device to eliminate clogged sinks; a worry-free way to share lip balm without sharing germs; a climate-control system for beds; and an update on Barbara Corcoran's investment in Tom+Chee from Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 701. Season 7 begins with Ashton Kutcher appearing as a "guest shark." Products being pitched include a device to make feeding a baby easier; a new high-tech form of wearable transportation; old-fashioned drinking vinegars; and a solution to crowd-hack-attacks on credit and debit cards. Also: The founders of Pipcorn and Scratch and Grain offer updates on their companies(n)

programme.title: The Deed: Chicago
programme.desc: The Mistake On The Lake. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 514. A woman tries to sell the Sharks on her special mud mask from Alaska. Also: a power strip that blends in with hardwood floors; a company specializing in balloon entertainment; and an update on the founders of Tom and Chee, who successfully pitched their franchise idea to Mark and Barbara during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 613. A Brooklyn man tries to spark interest in his family-run business of foldable, wheeled luggage; a Houston woman has a line of soaps and grooming products to pitch; a couple from Sapulpa, Okla., show off their gameday apparel for women; and a Scarsdale, N.Y., entrepreneur gives the Sharks a taste of his single-serve wine that comes in recyclable plastic. Also: Lori Greiner offers an update on her "All-Stars."(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with guest Nina Hossain alongside Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Cousin Danny loses his job, so Doug comes under pressure from Uncle Stu to find him a new one at IPS - a situation he is keen to avoid. Meanwhile, Arthur takes part in a test audience for a new film. Comedy, starring Kevin James, Gary Valentine and Jerry Stiller.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Part one of two. Carrie discovers she is expecting a baby. Deacon and Kelly make a move to reconcile, leaving Spence out on a limb, and Arthur asks Doug to build him a bathroom in the basement. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Leah Remini.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Part two of two. Doug takes on a second job as a chauffeur to supplement his income, pressured by the expense of the new baby and bathroom. Meanwhile, Deacon and Kelly are reconciled with each other - leaving Spence all alone. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray refuses to take Debra to an awards ceremony, tired of her constant lateness, while Frank and Robert get into their own heated debate about the importance of punctuality. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton, Peter Boyle and Doris Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra wants to buy an expensive dress for Ally to wear to a friend's 13th birthday party, but Ray refuses to spend $250 on something that will only be used once, and naturally Marie takes his side. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Madylin Sweeten.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin spends a romantic evening with a neighbour - to the surprise of Frasier, who causes family friction by discussing their date on his radio show. Meanwhile, Roz goes out with a Star Trek fan. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin persuades Frasier to take part in a charity auction, where he is thrilled to be bought by a model - but all she wants him to do is babysit her daughter. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Joe DiDomizio, CEO of travel retailer Hudson Group, goes undercover to ensure the company is fighting fit for the future. The businessman hopes to find that the company's vow to be `the traveller's best friend' is being upheld by his employees.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a mother-and-son team who have gone through 20 chefs in two years at their struggling Italian restaurant in California. The adjoining bar is a triumph, but the oldest dining establishment in town needs an overhaul if the inexperienced owners are to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller tends to a rescue pup with a long list of problems and is also under pressure when his head nurse Emma brings in her own cat for treatment.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou and the team receive a visit from a former Chelsea footballer who has brought along some expensive watches. James is also put to the test when asked to evaluate a hovercraft from a Bond film, and an unusual painting of Saddam Hussein causes a stir in the office. Also, there's a big surprise for a mother looking to sell some spectacular jewellery to help her son's business venture.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Nicki Chapman is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: David and Pam Rowe are searching for their dream retirement home, so Spanish Property Choice line three apartments up for them to see within their 110,000 euro budget.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, married couple Karen and Nigel kick off the competition with a Bajan-themed menu, followed by Beth and Clem's meal, and Jo and Charlie's Greek night.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer offers to donate a kidney to Grampa - until he realises the surgery will place his own life at risk. However, a supernatural experience prompts him to think again.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Maxine keeps important information from Adam, assuming he's chosen Darcy over her, while Leela's stalker pulls the next stunt. Elsewhere, Sally is furious with Neeta, and a new arrival at Hollyoaks High causes a stir with Peri.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Stomp, a 13-year-old male okapi, is being encouraged to mate with younger female K'Tusha. But on his first attempt, he snaps his horn and causes K'Tusha a minor injury. Cameras at Chester Zoo also follow African painted dogs as they compete to be pack leader, and Raja the Bornean river turtle meets two prospective mates.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Cameras follow the drama at Liverpool Women's Hospital, where Jodie, 19, found out that she was pregnant after she had a fling with Stephen, 22. He's determined to see his parental responsibilities through, including being at her bedside during a long labour. Also featured is 44-year-old Derroll, who met his wife Maria online. She's a mother of four and wants him to experience fatherhood for himself, but it's not without its challenges.(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Rob and Sharon are in Ireland to say goodbye to her dad, while his irrepressible mum, Mia travels from America to pay her version of respects, and do some jumper shopping. With Fran reeling in shock and Rob still unable to find the right time to talk about his almost-secret collapse, all roads are leading to a dramatic series finale. Comedy starring Rob Delaney, Sharon Horgan, Ashley Jensen and in one of her final roles, Carrie Fisher. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is Us
programme.desc: Jack heads to Cleveland to make things right with Rebecca on the night of her first gig, and Randall, Kate and Kevin make big decisions about their futures. Starring Milo Ventimiglia and Mandy Moore. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 16 Kids and Counting
programme.desc: Cameras return to the Radfords family home as Lancashire pie-maker Noel, Sue and the children prepare to welcome a new baby to their ever-growing brood and only weeks later set off on their most ambitious family holiday to date. In Australia, the Radfords meet that nation's biggest family, the Bonnells, who have 16 kids but enforce much stricter house rules. As the Radfords explore Australia's Gold Coast, cooking kangaroo pies for their hosts and falling out with each other on the other side of the world.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yanni's in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasn't allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peter's family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns.(n)

programme.title: Gillette World Sport
programme.desc: Action from the Miami Open tennis event, part of the ATP Masters series. Plus, sports science is applied to three NBA players' statistics, hoping to pinpoint what makes them elite.(n)

programme.title: Staying Healthy: A Doctor's Guide
programme.desc: Dr Pixie McKenna crunches the NHS's health data to reveal what made people ill in 2016. She believes that if people understand when and how the nation falls ill, many will have a better chance of staying well in the year ahead. She reveals how changing the clocks could be a health hazard, and why it's not just cases of cold and flu that rocket when the kids go back to school.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil Spencer heads to Stockton Heath in Warrington, Cheshire, to help a couple sell their house that has been on the market for more than three months without a single offer.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton helps a woman and her boyfriend build a dream home in Peebles, Scotland, where the whole ground floor is devoted to stables for her horses.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Husband and wife team Dave and Jenny move a collection of 19th-century stained glass windows nearly 200 miles, while Phil and `Mad Dog' unload the wooden dragon.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Nicki Chapman is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie decide to try for a baby - but with Arthur under their feet, finding time alone proves difficult. The delivery driver keeps the old man occupied by hiring a dog walker to listen to his stories about the Second World War. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug treats Carrie to laser eye surgery for her birthday - but the side effects leave her blind for a week, and she's not happy to learn her husband chose the cheapest doctor he could find.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug's colleagues resent his achievement in breaking the record for perfect deliveries, while Carrie wonders why the dog walker enjoys spending time with her father. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert contemplates leaving the police force to take up a job selling security systems, but the proposal receives a mixed reaction, leading to tense celebrations at his birthday party. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Brad Garrett and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is delighted to be awarded an honorary doctorate, but hurts Debra's feelings by thanking everyone except her in his acceptance speech. He claims it was an accident, though she takes the opportunity to remind him of past snubs that were obviously deliberate.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: You Can't Tell a Crook by His Cover.
programme.desc: Daphne goes on a date with an ex-convict, but fortunately the Crane brothers are close at hand to protect her honour. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Show Where Lilith Comes Back.
programme.desc: A convention brings Frasier's ex-wife Lilith to Seattle, but he discovers there is a hidden agenda behind her visit. Comedy, guest starring Bebe Neuwirth.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Miller, CEO of the Larry H Miller Group of Companies and co-owner of National Basketball Association team the Utah Jazz, goes undercover. Since his dad died he has made many changes to the organisation, and posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition to win a dream job, he works among his own staff to see if his father's legacy still lives on.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to West Nyack, New York, to come to the aid of a family-run Mexican restaurant that is suffering a financial crisis, and a case of hard-headed patriarchy. When the chef arrives he finds himself turfing out the existing customers for their own safety due to a cockroach infestation on the premises.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller treats an elderly cat with a worrying lump in its abdomen, while an overweight dog is limping badly and needs an operation to save its damaged knee.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Boss James Constantinou and the team appraise more items brought along by members of the public. A divorcee from Newcastle wants to sell her £185,000 necklace to pay for her children's private-school fees, a crystal-covered drum kit used on a Kylie Minogue tour catches the eye of staff member Patrick, and a widowed pensioner hopes to make a fortune from her precious rings. Plus, a valuation doesn't come easy to the experts when a client turns up with a 7ft Terminator model.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Nicki Chapman alongside Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple search for a home big enough for them and their eight children in Alicante, and the agency takes on a huge property that includes a luxurious cat hotel in the basement.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from the north east of England compete for the £1,000 prize - first up are loved-up musicians Nick and Kelly, followed by Matthew and Katie, and Michael and Becky.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer accidentally saves Mayor Quimby from a rioting mob and is appointed his official bodyguard, but finds himself up against local gangster Fat Tony. Featuring the guest voice of Mark Hamill (Star Wars).(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Darcy persuades Adam to take her to a posh restaurant as a thank you for helping at the salon. Liam teams up with Kim, and Myra continues to manipulate Sally. Meanwhile, Grace bumps into Maxine at the hospital and notes how upset she is about Minnie.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who struggled to find their first marital home, including Rupreet and Sundeep who had their hearts set on a specific area in Harrow. Phil also revisits Paul and Elly, who searched for a property in Bristol, to see if they found the perfect house.(n)

programme.title: Auction of a Lifetime
programme.sub-title: Marilyn Monroe: Auction of a Lifetime.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Marilyn Monroe's life story, told through some of her most personal and glamorous possessions, and interviews with those who knew her well. The programme focuses on an auction that took place in November 2016 in Los Angeles, where many of the Hollywood icon's most sought-after belongings were sold.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Trumps: From Immigrant to President
programme.desc: Donald Trump is the 45th President of the United States and commander in chief of America's armed forces, the most powerful position in the world. This documentary goes back to his roots, to reveal the story of his family. It reveals how Trump's penniless German grandfather arrived in America in the 1880s, and ended up running bars and brothels in the gold rush. And how his Scottish mother travelled from the Outer Hebrides to New York and worked as a maid before marrying Donald's tycoon father.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The popular armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring Line of Duty, University Challenge, Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad, Comic Relief, Broadchurch, One Night with my Ex, All Round to Mrs Brown's and the News.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.desc: Pip sets out to show he has the ship-building skills of his ancestors, and builds a sand yacht to race along the beach.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: Hatsie feels unwell, so Nonna volunteers to take over her deliveries. However, Nonna has never driven a train before and things fail to go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The heroine spots a tadpole in her glass of water. Animation, narrated by Julian Clary.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: A baby elephant escapes when the circus comes to town, and the Paw Patrol sets out to find the animal.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his team are asked to create a temporary city beach in Spring City, but it proves harder than expected to keep the beach tidy.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy Fire Station is opened to the public and Norman is eager to try things out, crawling under safety tape and getting into the driving seat of a fire engine. However, his inquisitive nature and desire for excitement lead to danger when he climbs onto the roof to get closer to Tom and his helicopter.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Paxton overhears Toby say that Thomas has `lost his puff' after he accidentally gets his firebox wet.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet climbs aboard a special bus, and sets off on a tour to learn more about the world.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: The girls meet a Lightning Genie and help him catch his bolt.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Amazing Eyebrows.
programme.desc: Fuse wants to wear his new eyebrows when he collects his trophy at the Toyland awards, but they have gone missing, and Noddy is accused of theft.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder and the team must rescue a girl and her cat when they become stuck on the ski lift while enjoying a day trip on Jake's Mountain.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Gaston catches a cold, so Holly invites him to stay at the castle.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Grizel finds a way to disguise herself as Digby, and enjoys tormenting his friends. They cannot understand why he is behaving so badly.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa pays a visit to Aunty and Uncle Pig, and discovers Cousin Chloe has a new puppet theatre.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The youngster tries to get Daddy Pig fit and healthy.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Peggy feels left out because all the baby penguins except her have had their own special day, so Wissper organises a party.(n)

programme.title: Toot the Tiny Tugboat
programme.desc: Bethan wants to start a collection, and Toot offers to help - but she cannot decide what she wants to collect.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Shazia Javed becomes concerned when she meets Mohammed, a young boy with an unusually high temperature and no identifiable cause and decides to send him to the hospital. Meanwhile, the team are shocked when they discover a patient has driven himself to the surgery after showing symptoms of a stroke, and Dr Nithy Nanda takes action when he meets Christopher and discovers complications following a recent operation.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on four single parents struggling to provide for their children while living on state welfare. Lauren dreams of a career in the Army, where she would get help with childcare, and 40-year-old Joanne is struggling to heat the home she shares with her eight-year-old daughter. Craig has only recently taken sole responsibility for his daughter after the end of his relationship, while clairvoyant and mother-of-six Sue is planing a council house swap - but competition is fierce.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Sun-kissed Australian soap charting the latest comings and goings of the Summer Bay regulars.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: David narrows down who he thinks his father is, Elly confesses to Susan that Finn declared his love for her, and Toadie determines to get his marriage back on track.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when two pharmaceutical executives are murdered, uncovering a criminal who changes his identity for each offence he commits, and has evaded capture across several countries. To make matters worse, the agents are made to feel the pressure by the watchful eye of Granger. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and Miguel Ferrer.(n)

programme.title: Strangers in Amish Country
programme.desc: Premiere. A military nurse returns from a tour of duty in Afghanistan to her family's farm in rural Ohio, and falls for an Amish neighbour after an intruder wreaks havoc. Romantic drama, starring Jes Macallan, Sean Faris and Kelly McGillis.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: David narrows down who he thinks his father is, Elly confesses to Susan that Finn declared his love for her, and Toadie determines to get his marriage back on track.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Sun-kissed Australian soap charting the latest comings and goings of the Summer Bay regulars.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Gordon Morris leads a raid on the house of a suspected drug user, but the door won't budge. Meanwhile, Rich Woodward is in pursuit of a souped-up hot hatch, a late-night reveller kicks off in Nantwich town centre, and police dog Bonnie is used in the hunt for two runaways.(n)

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Documentary examining one of London's most recognised landmarks, St Paul's Cathedral. This film covers its creation by Christopher Wren after the great fire of London in 1666, Hitler's attempt to weaken British morale during the Second World War by destroying the building, and its first royal wedding between Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer in 1981.(n)

programme.title: A Year in the Wild
programme.sub-title: Yorkshire: A Year in the Wild: Autumn.
programme.desc: Autumn is on hold as summer continues, with unexpectedly balmy conditions throwing a life line to the roe deer as they prepare for the winter ahead. For other animals, mating season has arrived, making for a dangerous and testosterone-fuelled time at Ravenscar Beach.(n)

programme.title: Restless Legs Syndrome: Desperate for Help
programme.desc: Documentary about people with a compulsion to constantly move their feet. It's a condition so severe for some that they want to have their legs chopped off. Cameras follow the pensioner who contemplates suicide due to severe sleep deprivation caused by his tingling legs, and the sufferer who is housebound due to the embarrassment of her wriggling legs.(n)

programme.title: The Boy Who Sees Upside Down
programme.desc: The story of 12-year-old Mahendra Ahirwar from central India, who lives with a rare muscle-wasting condition not only means he can not stand or walk, but also leaves his neck muscles so weak, he cannot lift his head up at all. His family have been unable to pay for any treatment - but when his story was reported in the UK Press, Liverpool woman Julie Jones was so moved by Mahendra's plight that she set up an online fundraising page. Cameras follow his pioneering surgery.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Britain's Most Married Man.
programme.desc: Profile of a 67-year-old Somerset man who is hoping to get married for the ninth time, once his 27-year-old fiancee arrives from the Philippines. Ron believes that having Cristel around to care for him during in his old age will make him less of a burden on the state. Plus, a Lowestoft carer who looks after his wife hopes that moving into their first proper home together will bring them more happiness, and an out-of-work Liverpool man dreams of a life on the ocean waves.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren and Eames are called out to an apparent suicide, but come to different initial conclusions as to whether Theresa Esperna actually killed herself or was murdered. Further investigation reveals that she worked at a bank whose only client was the Catholic Church and her specific role was to manage the trust fund set up to pay compensation settlements in sexual abuse cases involving priests. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Erbe and Vincent D'Onofrio.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell explores the history of the design and construction of the Tyne Bridge and discovers that many believe that it was the inspiration for the Sydney Harbour Bridge. He also discovers why the bridge is so revered by Geordies, not just as a way to cross the river, but because it was built to keep shipbuilders employed and their skills alive during the dark days of the 1920s recession.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice tackles a Glasgow bachelor pad set in a sought-after stately home address in city-centre parkland, but the ancient Egyptian theme proves a sticking point.(n)

programme.title: HouseBusters
programme.desc: Janet Ellis and her team of new-age practitioners suggest ways in which changes to homes could positively affect the lives of their owners.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: Hazel Taylor takes a frustrating walk in the countryside with Simon Cowell - who must then confront his fear of snakes to rescue one from a garden. The list of mouths to feed increases when some baby hedgehogs arrive at the centre, and a large swan causes a stir.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.desc: As Skipper prepares to exhibit his collection of model boats, Hopper drops in and accidently breaks one.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: Chloe, Riley and new friend Carys help a T-Rex who wants to play baseball with the other animals in the zoo.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster fancies herself as a chef and decides to bake a birthday cake for the General.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Mayor Goodway's prize chicken goes missing and the puppies help to locate her. Animation about a pack of puppies led by a 10-year-old boy called Ryder.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team restore Fixham Castle, but Scoop learns of the legend of a lost silver shield and starts digging where he should not.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman tries to produce a spectacle to rival Mike's rocket show by holding his own in Pontypandy.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Duck and Thomas take Harold the helicopter to Sodor Search and Rescue Centre when he breaks down near Callan Castle.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet makes waves as he drives an unusual tractor.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: The twin genies-in-training discover a magical gem that makes two of everything - including Zeta.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Hiding Pirates.
programme.desc: When Scurvy the parrot arrives at Toy Green for the Pirate Parade all on his own, Noddy soon realises the pirates are missing and investigates why they are hiding.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder charts how the pup joined the Paw Patrol after rescuing Jake from an avalanche.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The duo get trapped by the tide on a family trip to the seaside.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Digby reads the story of Black McKracken to Sprite - and then hears a McKracken-like noise outside. Could it be that Red Rufus' arch enemy is here in Applecross?.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George have to tidy up their bedroom, which is soon clean with the help of Daddy and Mummy Pig - but it does not stay that way for long.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa visit the playground and Daddy Pig gets a new video camera.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Kevin the croc somehow manages to get stuck high up in a tree, when he finally works out how to get down, he invents a cracking new game for the monkeys.(n)

programme.title: Toot the Tiny Tugboat
programme.desc: Toot uses a farmer's plough to clear thick seaweed that is clogging up the harbour, and finds out how the smelly green plant can be really useful.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and his guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The doctors treat patients with mental health problems, including a woman pregnant with twins who is afraid she is developing depression and is referred to a crisis team. A man with schizophrenia suffers physical side-effects from his medication, a patient struggles to separate fiction from reality, and a mother seeks help for her son, who hurts himself when he cannot control his anger.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Craig Charles puts some state-of-the-art headphones to the test. These wireless units incorporate a voice-controlled smart assistant and a fitness tracker, all for £99. Jon Bentley dials up Chinese smartphone the Huawei Honor 6X to see if it is actually better than its more established rivals - and at a fraction of current prices. Plus, Georgie Barrat gets exclusive access to the New York Toy Fair, to check out latest tech playthings that will hit the shops in a few months' time.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Ash allows his frustrations to get the better of him and seeks solace in alcohol, while Leah remains furious with Zac, who gets an offer of support from Sam.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: The Tanakas reel from the news about their father. A troubled Sonya is comforted by Mark, who claims that his feelings towards her are completely platonic.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team works with Abigail Borin of the Coast Guard Investigative Service after a highly suspicious explosion and fire on board an oil rig kills a US marine corps reservist. Abby detects malware in the platform's computer systems, while Ducky finds traces on the victim's body that lead to a lawyer who works for the oil company. Back in the office, a prankster is bringing some light relief and although the likeliest suspect is Tony, he denies any involvement. Crime drama, guest starring Diane Neal.(n)

programme.title: Abducted: The Carlina White Story
programme.desc: A couple take their three-week-old baby to a hospital for treatment, but she is snatched by a woman desperate for a child. She raises the infant as her own for years, but as the girl grows up, she begins to suspect the truth and resolves to investigate her kidnapping and find her parents. Fact-based drama, starring Keke Palmer and Aunjanue Ellis. Edited for drug use.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: The Tanakas reel from the news about their father. A troubled Sonya is comforted by Mark, who claims that his feelings towards her are completely platonic.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Ash allows his frustrations to get the better of him and seeks solace in alcohol, while Leah remains furious with Zac, who gets an offer of support from Sam.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Ancient Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Revealed - The Truth About the Holy Grail.
programme.desc: Documentary examining the possible whereabouts of the ancient Christian relic, reputed to be the cup that Jesus drank from at the Last Supper and that received His blood at the Crucifixion. In 2014, historian Margarita Torres discovered two Arabic parchments recording the journey of Christ's cup from Jerusalem to Spain in 1055. One parchment states that the cup arrived in Spain with a piece missing. The onyx cup in Leon's San Isidora basilica matches this description. In Leon, Torres finds further evidence that this may be the Holy Grail in a medieval painting of the Supper.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A pregnant woman suffering from abdominal pain visits the surgery, and worries that her unborn baby has also stopped moving in the last 24 hours. Meanwhile, an epileptic patient is left physically and mentally exhausted after suffering from frequent seizures, and a new mother's check-up suggests she may be suffering from post-natal depression.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents chase more than £1,700 in unpaid parking fines in south-east London, but struggle to pinpoint the debtor. Meanwhile, officers in north Wales try to recover the £2,000 owed by a tradesman to a former employer, and in Kent agents chase £8,000 owed by a jewellery shop to two former employees.(n)

programme.title: One Night With My Ex
programme.desc: Another three ex-couples spend a night alone together, featuring young parents Scott and Laura, who ended their relationship after Scott's infidelity left Laura unable to trust him. Plus, couple Chloe and Christian who broke up at university try to make amends, and Sophie and Luke spend the night together after two years apart.(n)

programme.title: Gypsy Kids: Our Secret World
programme.desc: The first in a three-part documentary series exploring childhood in Gypsy and traveller communities, beginning with an introduction to 12-year-old Oliver, who has already learned to drive, but believes his true vocation in life lies with horses. Also featured are 13-year-old aspiring model Sylvanna, who must decide whether to take a lucrative contract or preserve her identity, and eight-year-old Margaret, who might jeopardise a sparkling academic career should she choose to follow her sister's example and leave school at the age of 11.(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Grand Visions is a short season of films driven by the vision and boldness of strong directors; passion projects made on a grand and uncompromising scale. The season kicks off with director Baz Luhrmann's western/ war adventure/ romance hybrid that's set in the Australian outback and stars Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. It is 1939 and Lady Sarah Ashley has travelled halfway round the world to persuade her husband to sell his cattle station and return back home to Blighty. It's soon obvious that she hasn't anticipated the primitive realities of life in northern Australia, nor has her upbringing prepared her for an encounter with the likes of the rough and ready drover who is instructed to chaperone her from Darwin to the ranch. But the pair are fated to become much more closely acquainted than either could have imagined. The plot also encompasses the lot of the region's Aboriginal people, via the plight of local lad Nullah, and the first Japanese attacks on the northern territories. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: James Cox directs the sleazy Hollywood murder tale Wonderland, starring Val Kilmer as legendary porn star John Holmes. Using a non-linear plot structure, the film explores different perspectives of the quadruple homicide that occurred on July 1, 1981, in the Hollywood Hills. At the lowest point of his career and the height of his drug addiction, Holmes was implicated in the murders of the Wonderland gang: Ron Launius (Josh Lucas), Billy Deverell (Tim Blake Nelson), Barbara Richardson (Natasha Gregson Wagner), and Joy Miller (Janeane Garofalo). Launius' wife, Susan (Christina Applegate), was the only survivor. Led by Detective Sam Nico (Ted Levine), the police investigation reveals a dark criminal underworld surrounding Holmes, his disapproving wife, Sharon (Lisa Kudrow), and his innocent teenage girlfriend, Dawn Schiller (Kate Bosworth). Eric Bogosian stars as notorious Hollywood nightclub owner Eddie Nash. Wonderland premiered at the 2003 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Bad Boys
programme.desc: Gritty drama. Mick O'Brien, a teenager from Chicago, must face the ultimate consequence when he is linked to the death of a rival gang member's younger brother(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A stolen painting and a crooked land deal intertwines the destinies of a Russian mobster, a London gangster and a junkie punk rocker in writer-director Guy Ritchie's stylish and clever caper film starring Gerard Butler ("300") and Tom Wilkinson ("John Adams")(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride, a tight-knit gang of street racers must battle the brother of a defeated nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists. The film is dedicated to series regular Paul Walker, who died halfway through production(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: From one of the best sports books ever written comes a compelling, fact-based chronicle of a high-school football team in West Texas. There, winning isn't everything, it's the only thing. Billy Bob Thornton stars as the coach, and country-music star Tim McGraw plays the abusive father of a player. The film was directed and co-written by Peter Berg, who adapted his cousin H.G. Bissinger's bestseller(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Drama about an unconventional new English teacher and his ultimately questionable impact on an elite Vermont boys' academy. Robin Williams, in a straight role, blows into the stuffy halls of academe like a breath of fresh air, startling colleagues and delighting boys with his disdain for traditional teaching methods and text books. But the seeds of rebellion he sows have far-reaching effects that he never intended(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: Classic sidesplittingly funny comedy stars John Belushi as the head of the delinquent Delta House fraternity that the dean of Faber College plans to rid his campus of(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Dave Chappelle's Block Party
programme.desc: In September 2004, comedian Dave Chappelle took a break from his immensely successful Comedy Central show to stage a free, unpublicized, all-star hip-hop concert in the Clinton Hill neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY. Inviting fans over the Internet, on the street, and even in his family's hometown of Yellow Springs, OH, Chappelle asked filmmaker Michel Gondry to document the event from its inception on through to the performances themselves. The result is Dave Chappelle's Block Party, a concert film that provides not only a sampling of the music on display that September, but also an intimate look at the comedian himself. Gondry's cameras tag along with Chappelle as he visits Ohio, recruits a university marching band to play at the show, and surveys the opinions of Clinton Hill on the show that's about to take place. Along the way, we're introduced to some the comedian's favorite acts, in rehearsals and on-stage: Dead Prez, Jill Scott, Mos Def, the Roots, Erykah Badu, Kanye West, and the surprise reuniting of the Fugees(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: When a plane crash lands in the middle of nowhere, one of the passengers claims he can build a new craft out of the wreckage(n)

programme.title: Paper Towns
programme.desc: In this moving coming-of-age tale, a nerdy teen falls for the enigmatic girl next door, who vanishes after the two have an adventure together one night. She leaves behind a trail of clues, which lead him and his pals to go on a road trip to find her(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalised when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard. Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. The more Steve learns about Ayers, the more he longs to help the troubled soul(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: Docudrama about terminally ill New Jersey police officer Laurel Hester, whose 2005 legal battle for the right to pass her pension benefits on to her female life partner became an equal-rights milestone(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: After a disastrous summer, Harry returns to begin his fifth year at Hogwarts, one of the toughest he will ever have. A few group of students and parents believe him or Dumbledore that Voldemort is really back, and a never-ending series of articles states that they are insane. On top of that, Dolores Umbridge, the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher, proves to be the nastiest person Harry has ever encountered(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In this harrowing historical drama set in the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Max Payne is a widowed cop hell-bent on delivering justice no matter what the cost as he investigates a string of killings in his city(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: David Fincher's follow-up to Fight Club is a claustrophobic thriller starring Jodie Foster and Kirsten Stewart as a mother and daughter trapped in their new house's safe room by a gang of thieves. The housebreakers are a dynamic trio desperate to get their hands on millions of dollars' worth of bonds the previous owner left behind, and their arrival prompts divorcee Meg and 11-year-old Sarah to take refuge in the vault-like room of the title. Unfortunately for them, that's where the loot is concealed, and Fincher ramps up the tension with some exhilarating camera work as a deadly stand-off ensues(n)

programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride, a tight-knit gang of street racers must battle the brother of a defeated nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists. The film is dedicated to series regular Paul Walker, who died halfway through production(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: From one of the best sports books ever written comes a compelling, fact-based chronicle of a high-school football team in West Texas. There, winning isn't everything, it's the only thing. Billy Bob Thornton stars as the coach, and country-music star Tim McGraw plays the abusive father of a player. The film was directed and co-written by Peter Berg, who adapted his cousin H.G. Bissinger's bestseller(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Drama about an unconventional new English teacher and his ultimately questionable impact on an elite Vermont boys' academy. Robin Williams, in a straight role, blows into the stuffy halls of academe like a breath of fresh air, startling colleagues and delighting boys with his disdain for traditional teaching methods and text books. But the seeds of rebellion he sows have far-reaching effects that he never intended(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: Classic sidesplittingly funny comedy stars John Belushi as the head of the delinquent Delta House fraternity that the dean of Faber College plans to rid his campus of(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Dave Chappelle's Block Party
programme.desc: In September 2004, comedian Dave Chappelle took a break from his immensely successful Comedy Central show to stage a free, unpublicized, all-star hip-hop concert in the Clinton Hill neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY. Inviting fans over the Internet, on the street, and even in his family's hometown of Yellow Springs, OH, Chappelle asked filmmaker Michel Gondry to document the event from its inception on through to the performances themselves. The result is Dave Chappelle's Block Party, a concert film that provides not only a sampling of the music on display that September, but also an intimate look at the comedian himself. Gondry's cameras tag along with Chappelle as he visits Ohio, recruits a university marching band to play at the show, and surveys the opinions of Clinton Hill on the show that's about to take place. Along the way, we're introduced to some the comedian's favorite acts, in rehearsals and on-stage: Dead Prez, Jill Scott, Mos Def, the Roots, Erykah Badu, Kanye West, and the surprise reuniting of the Fugees(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: When a plane crash lands in the middle of nowhere, one of the passengers claims he can build a new craft out of the wreckage(n)

programme.title: Paper Towns
programme.desc: In this moving coming-of-age tale, a nerdy teen falls for the enigmatic girl next door, who vanishes after the two have an adventure together one night. She leaves behind a trail of clues, which lead him and his pals to go on a road trip to find her(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalised when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard. Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. The more Steve learns about Ayers, the more he longs to help the troubled soul(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: Docudrama about terminally ill New Jersey police officer Laurel Hester, whose 2005 legal battle for the right to pass her pension benefits on to her female life partner became an equal-rights milestone(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: After a disastrous summer, Harry returns to begin his fifth year at Hogwarts, one of the toughest he will ever have. A few group of students and parents believe him or Dumbledore that Voldemort is really back, and a never-ending series of articles states that they are insane. On top of that, Dolores Umbridge, the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher, proves to be the nastiest person Harry has ever encountered(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.sub-title: The Playing Card Killer: Alfredo Galan
programme.desc: The Playing Card Killer: Alfredo Galan. Desde la escuela, Alfredo Galán siempre quiso ser el centro de atención, al no lograrlo se une al ejército. Estando en las fuerzas de paz españolas en la cuidad de Mostar, estaba bajo órdenes estrictas de no responder a provocaciones. El aspirante a héroe se sintió inútil, le dijo a un amigo en privado que él quería saber cómo se sentía matar. De regreso a España, fue enviado para ayudar a la limpieza de un derrame petrolero y sintió que era una tarea que no estaba a su altura. Cuando una simple discusión con un trabajador civil se tornó violento, tuvo que abandonar el ejército por motivos médicos. Luego pasó semanas esperando decidir a quien matar...al azar. Su primera víctima fue un portero, el segundo un hombre que esperaba el autobús. Galán se convertiría en uno de los peores asesinos en serie de España con seis víctimas y dejando como identificador curioso, un naipe en los cuerpos de cada víctima(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tests the new BMW M4 at the track, before switching to the German manufacturer's hybrid-powered i8 for a trip up the A1 to Whitby, North Yorkshire, where he decides which of the two he would rather take for the drive home. With Land Rover production ceasing in the UK later this year, Richard Hammond pays tribute to the 4x4 by attempting to drive one straight up the side of a dam, while James May puts the Mercedes AMG GT through its paces. Taking to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car are Will Smith and Margot Robbie.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit. The trio are also joined by The Voice mentor Will.i am, who takes the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve Darnell and the crew work on a tatty old vehicle that has been sprung from the desert and looks like something from the Mad Max movies.(n)

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to make an ordinary second-hand car lap the test track as fast as a new, purpose-built sports saloon. James May meets former Formula 1 World Champion Mika Hakkinen to discover why Finns are such good racing drivers, Richard Hammond tests the Veritas sports car, and actor Mark Wahlberg is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Scrappers
programme.sub-title: Scrappers - Back in the Yard: The Italian Job.
programme.desc: The Walkers are planning a shopping trip to Italy to look at a car shredder - an expensive machine that could turn their fortunes around. While Lyndsay needs to be persuaded, Terry tells sales manager Lee the target while he's away is £4,000 a day. But things unravel on the first morning - half the lads don't turn up, there are no customers and everyone mucks around.(n)

programme.title: Scrappers
programme.sub-title: Scrappers - Back in the Yard: Dream Machine.
programme.desc: Terry's back from Italy, inspired and dreaming of buying an expensive car-shredding machine. However, to pay for it will involve selling a plot of land set aside for a retirement home. Lyndsay reveals to daughter Jemma that she also wants to get the shredder, but there's no point unless the yard runs properly, and before long Terry's temper gets the better of him.(n)

Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back in 1983, 16-year-old Amy Taskerland was murdered on the night of the school disco. More than 30 years later, the unearthing of a time capsule and the discovery of her voice on a mix tape inside prompts Miller and co to delve back into the case, starting by interviewing Amy's best friend Harriet and her former teacher Mr Hines. The recording features a strange mix of music and poetry, including words from a speech written in secret for the Queen for broadcast in the event of a nuclear war. But how did Amy get a copy of it, and was its secret nature the reason she was killed? Elsewhere, Miller enjoys her first romance since her divorce, while Gerry goes on his future son-in-law's stag night. Amy Nuttall (Emmerdale, Downton Abbey) and Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe) guest star.(n)

programme.desc: Barney gives Ted advice after he has his first big fight with Robin, while Lily persuades them to make up. However, later that night the friends go to a party for lawyers - and Lily and Robin are told Ted has left with another woman. Neil Patrick Harris and Josh Radnor star.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Lily moves into Barney's flat to escape her rat-infested home, and though he initially resents her presence, he soon sees the benefits of having her around. Meanwhile, Marshall befriends a fellow law student who has also just split up with his girlfriend. Comedy, starring Alyson Hannigan and Jason Segel.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Hoping that Pops' good luck can rub off on him, Adam takes to gambling at school - but ends up losing his toys. Erica wants to take part in a popular TV dance show, but when she gets the chance her dream quickly turns into a nightmare.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam and Beverly create a music video to help Erica's application to Julliard, Murray learns what it means to be a real friend when he bonds with Lainey's dad Bill.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's parents set him up on a blind date in the hope of initiating an arranged marriage, but after a promising start it becomes apparent that the girl in question is more interested in Sheldon. Meanwhile, Penny begins her new job as a bartender. Starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon receive an invitation to present their research to a physics conference, but Sheldon's reluctance to pander to his peers causes conflict between the friends. An intervention by Penny makes matters worse. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted misses his flight to Chicago for a job interview at a prestigious architecture company, so he and Robin retrace their steps to determine who is to blame. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney lands himself in trouble by being too honest about Lily's performance in a play, while Ted and Robin fall out over what to do with all the belongings they own that were gifts from previous partners. Starring Josh Radnor, Alyson Hannigan, Neil Patrick Harris and Cobie Smulders.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Jake's favourite pizzeria burns down, the fire marshal (Patton Oswalt) believes the owner should be the prime suspect in the investigation. Outraged, the detective does everything in his power to prove him wrong, even if it means stepping outside his jurisdiction. Meanwhile, chaos ensues at the precinct after a computer virus publishes everyone's internet browser history.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Santiago hosts a Thanksgiving dinner at her apartment for all her colleagues, but the event risks turning into a disaster, especially when Holt and Peralta have to leave in a hurry to catch a thief who has stolen a large sum of money from the evidence lock-up. Can Boyle save the day?.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly tries to get Murray to invite his grouchy father to Thanksgiving dinner, but her brother-in-law Marvin interferes. Barry and Erica compete when it is suggested they should give the holiday toast. Judd Hirsch (Taxi) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: After Murray agrees to let him join the junior Reserve Officers Training Corps, Barry changes his mind when the going gets tough and begs Beverly to get him out of it. Adam objects when Pops buys a timeshare holiday home in Florida. Judd Hirsch (Taxi) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon finds himself forced to keep a secret when Penny decides to tell him what happened on her disappointing first date with Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is dejected to see Penny with another man and decides to cut his losses by going back to fellow scientist Leslie Winkle - a move that upsets Sheldon. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Sara Gilbert.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Kim is trying to keep Grace away from Esther, but Grace is beginning to worry. Elsewhere, Darren's money troubles get worse when his car breaks down, and he panics when Nancy suggests that they should go quad biking for the day as one of their bucket list activities.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry's JTP membership is in jeopardy while a family swear jar is introduced. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang's preparations for Star Wars Day are interrupted by the news that Professor Proton has died. Leonard and Penny attend the funeral, where they talk about their rejected marriage proposals, but Sheldon has difficulty dealing with the death of his childhood hero - until a surprise visitor helps him cope with his grief. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with a guest appearance by Bob Newhart.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang's annual trip to Comic-Con is thrown into doubt when Raj, who is no longer accepting his father's financial support, cannot afford to go.(n)

programme.title: The 100
programme.desc: New series. The post-apocalyptic drama returns, as Clarke and her friends struggle with the decision on how to proceed after learning about the terrible fate that awaits the world.(n)

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: An opportunity to take out a nest of vampires backfires, and the tables turn on Mary and the British Men of Letters, who have been trying desperately to recruit Sam and Dean.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon introduces Amy to Raiders of the Lost Ark - one of his favourite films - and is distraught when she ends up pointing out a plot hole that ruins the whole story. Meanwhile, Leonard realises he can manipulate Penny into feeling sorry for him when his mother publishes a reveal-all book about his childhood problems. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon re-evaluates the time he spends with Amy when she takes a job at the university. Meanwhile, Howard is forced to sleep on his friend's sofa after he gets into an argument with Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Mayim Bialik.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Documentary exploring aspects of animal anatomy, as Chris Packham uses groundbreaking science to look closely at predatory beings and what makes them successful.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: The science behind places like Canada's Bay of Fundy, where water levels rise as much as 50ft during high tide, and the 10ft `bores waves' of Alaska's Turnagain Arm.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: The effect of volcanoes on the weather, as eruptions create localised phenomena like acid rain and violent volcanic lightning.(n)

programme.title: How Earth Made Us
programme.desc: Professor Iain Stewart explores the influence of water, examining 6,000-year-old rock engravings that suggests the Sahara desert was once a much more hospitable place. He also traces the cycle of fresh water, discovering how an aberration in the pattern caused a severe drought in the Middle East during the last ice age. Finally, he demonstrates how the need for a reliable source of water has inspired some of the key advances in human civilisation.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough tells the tale of winged insects, witnessing mayflies emerging from their larval cases in central Hungary and purple crow butterflies in the valleys of Taiwan. Slow-motion cameras reveal the incredible flight skills that enable the creatures to find new territories and sources of food. The aeronautical tricks employed by heavier insects such as bees and beetles are also revealed.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Documentary exploring aspects of animal anatomy, as Chris Packham uses groundbreaking science to look closely at predatory beings and what makes them successful.(n)

programme.title: So You Think You'd Survive

programme.desc: The effect of volcanoes on the weather, as eruptions create localised phenomena like acid rain and violent volcanic lightning.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough tells the tale of winged insects, witnessing mayflies emerging from their larval cases in central Hungary and purple crow butterflies in the valleys of Taiwan. Slow-motion cameras reveal the incredible flight skills that enable the creatures to find new territories and sources of food. The aeronautical tricks employed by heavier insects such as bees and beetles are also revealed.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to South Africa to join a veterinary team trying to help a rhino called Thandi who was attacked by poachers for her horn. For the first time, a plastic surgeon will attempt a skin graft on the animal to heal the wound. She also visits the rainforest of Borneo to follow the story of an orangutan who needs cataracts removing from her eyes so that she can be released back into the wild. Elsewhere, vet Steve Leonard takes a trip to Chicago's Lincoln Park Zoo, where the latest technology is being used to help chimpanzees with heart disease. He also visits the South African city of Pretoria, where a Cape fur seal requires a CT scan to identify the root cause of her illness, and a giraffe urgently needs to be anaesthetised to treat a leg injury.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Documentary exploring aspects of animal anatomy, as Chris Packham uses groundbreaking science to look closely at predatory beings and what makes them successful.(n)

programme.title: So You Think You'd Survive
programme.desc: Harrowing caught-on-camera video footage reveals the perils of broken water mains, lightning, hot-air balloon crashes, rip currents and giant tsunamis.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: The effect of volcanoes on the weather, as eruptions create localised phenomena like acid rain and violent volcanic lightning.(n)

programme.title: How Earth Made Us
programme.desc: Professor Iain Stewart explores the influence of water, examining 6,000-year-old rock engravings that suggests the Sahara desert was once a much more hospitable place. He also traces the cycle of fresh water, discovering how an aberration in the pattern caused a severe drought in the Middle East during the last ice age. Finally, he demonstrates how the need for a reliable source of water has inspired some of the key advances in human civilisation.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: The effect of earthquakes on the earth's gravitational field, looking at the results of mapping by Nasa satellites which have found spots where the gravity is weaker.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: A look at how Earth's position in the solar system enables it to sustain life, while comparisons with Venus and Mars show how things might have been different.(n)

programme.title: How Earth Made Us
programme.desc: Iain Stewart reveals the effect that the Earth's winds have had on the development of civilisation. He visits the Saharan town of Chinguetti, once a vibrant transport hub, to learn how its success was due to global wind patterns, and explains how Christopher Columbus first made his name by mapping the trade winds off the coast of West Africa. Iain also shows how the rise of early Chinese civilisation was based on riches provided by the wind, but discovers a very different story at Australia's Mount Connor.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: An exploration of how invertebrates' production of silk 300 million years ago became their greatest invention. Stronger than a steel thread of the same diameter, the material is as pliable as elastic and employed by spiders for activities as diverse as courtship, catching prey and tending their young. David Attenborough reveals how some communal spiders create silken palaces rising 15m to 20m into the forest canopy.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to Japan where she visits inventor and vet Dr Keiichi Ueda. The vet has dedicated the past 12 years of his career to helping a dolphin called Fuji who has no tail as a result of a bacterial infection and he is hoping that a new prosthetic tail will enable her to swim properly again. Steve Leonard heads to the rainforest of Laos, where Edinburgh Zoo vet Romain Pizzi is undertaking keyhole surgery on a endangered moon bear called Champa who suffers from excess fluid on her brain. Steve then visits Florida where reptile specialist Doug Mader is using the latest technology to save Martha, an alligator with a badly blocked gut. Clare and Steve also follow the stories of a Galapagos tortoise with a mystery illness, a five-ton elephant suffering from an infected tusk and a tiger that keeps having nose bleeds.(n)
