programme.title: White Noise
programme.desc: Michael Keaton stars as an architect who is shattered by the death of his beloved wife, and is then contacted by a man (Ian McNeice) who claims he is receiving messages from his dead wife through Electronic Voice Phenomena, The grieving widower ultimately is convinced of the communication's validity, and soon becomes fixated on trying to contact his wife himself -- but his investigation into EVP inadvertently unlocks a door to another terrifying world(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: The Price of Power. After Elizabeth's coronation, an extravagant display designed to silence critics of their marriage, Edward needs a son to secure his reign. But tensions at court escalate into outright war and Edward must fight those closest to him to retain his crown. Elizabeth faces devastating loss as the full force of Warwick's hatred is revealed(n)

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: Morgan Freeman reprises his role as forensic psychologist Alex Cross. This time he teams up with Secret Service agent Jezzie Flannigan, who was responsible for the mistake that let a brilliant but deadly psychopath to kidnap a senator's daughter. As the clock ticks away, the pair realise that this kidnapping is just the beginning of the terror in Lee Tamahori's nail-biting adaptation of James Patterson's outstanding thriller(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: Mel Brooks for some reason decided to wait a decade before spoofing Star Wars and its ilk, and ten years was certainly too long to wait for this relatively weak offering from the comedy director. That said, there are a fair few laughs, mostly from Rick Moranis as Vader clone Dark Helmet and the late John Candy as the reliable space dog, Barf(n)

programme.desc: Sequel to the 1976 Oscar-winning favourite which catapulted Sylvester Stallone to megastardom. Things are looking grim for Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa. His wife is in a post-natal coma and he has an eye injury that could cost him his sight. But heavyweight champion Apollo Creed's pride is still smarting from their first bout, and he wants a rematch with the Italian Stallion(n)

programme.desc: A gambling addict persuades his brother-in-law to go on a cruise to snare wealthy women and con them out of a few bucks...but fails to tell him that the two will be waltzing their way across deck as the cruise dance instructors. Jack Lemmon, Walter Matthau, Dyan Cannon, Gloria De Haven, Brent Spiner, Elaine Stritch, Hal Linden, Donald O'Connor, Edward Mulhare, Rue McClanahan(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: The Storm. Desperate to further her son's claim to the throne, Margaret Beaufort joins Warwick's rebellion against Edward. The rebellion fails and the traitors must run for their lives. Jasper Tudor escapes into exile, while Warwick and George sail for France. Elizabeth and Jacquetta turn to witchcraft to stop them, but it is Isabel who is punished(n)

programme.title: Lakeview Terrace
programme.desc: An interracial couple moves into their California dream home, only to find themselves the target of their volatile next-door neighbor -- a racist LAPD officer -- in this tightly wound thriller starring Samuel L. Jackson and Kerry Washington. Newlyweds Chris and Lisa seem like they have the perfect marriage and now, with their new home in the exclusive community Lakeview Terrace, the perfect life as well, but things soon turn ugly in the posh neighborhood when they begin to receive threats from their neighbor Abel, a middle-aged LAPD officer who has obvious objections to the couple's interracial marriage. What starts as an attitude problem soon morphs into full-on harassment, and before long the couple finds that their worries go far beyond their property values -- or the encroaching California wildfire burning in view of their community -- as they begin to fear for their lives(n)

programme.title: Darkman
programme.desc: Fantasy thriller in which Liam Neeson is Peyton Westlake, a brilliant scientist on the verge of a breakthrough in his research on synthetic skin. An experimental medical procedure saves his life, but Westlake is both physically and psychologically scarred by the event, unable to continue a normal life with his girlfriend. However, when an encounter with a gang of brutal thugs leaves him close to death and scarred beyond recognition, Westlake retreats into the shadows, away from his girlfriend Julie and the rest of the outside world, setting up a new laboratory in an abandoned building. There, with the aid of his still-intact brilliant mind, Westlake refashions himself as the shadowy superhero Darkman(n)

programme.title: Burn Notice
programme.desc: The CIA denies Michael's request to see Fiona behind bars, so he calls upon his old mentor Tom Card - the man who abandoned him in the wake of his burn notice. In exchange for his assistance, Westen agrees to help stop a Mexican cartel from gaining a foothold in Miami. In prison, his ally is targeted by a ruthless gang leader, and must turn to a new friend to help fend them off.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: When a juror dies during the trial of a Mob boss, Brenda has her work cut out questioning the remainder of the jury, while an unannounced visit puts her plans with Fritz on hold. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and Jon Tenney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murders of three college students, apparently caught in the middle of a gang shootout. It transpires that one of the youngsters was the son of people known to Taylor. The detective also tries to keep her relationship with Fritz under wraps while her mother remains in town. Detective drama, with Kyra Sedgwick, Robert Gossett and Jon Tenney.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A Russian Mob leader's daughter is killed in what initially appears to be an act of gangland revenge against her father - until the focus of the investigation shifts to one of her classmates, who has an altogether more personal reason for wanting her dead. Drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A successful auditor appears to have killed his family and then himself, but an analysis of the crime scene suggests a different scenario. When Goren and Eames learn the dead man uncovered a pensions scandal involving retired cops, the trail leads to corruption within the force.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New Mossad director Orli Elbaz asks for the team's help in finding Ilan Bodnar when one of her agents is shot dead in Virginia, telling Gibbs he was investigating several operatives who had gone rogue after Eli David's death. Ziva travels with Tony to Berlin in her pursuit of Bodnar, the man she believes was responsible for the death of her father. Guest starring Marina Sirtis (Star Trek: The Next Generation).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tracks Bodnar's SUV to a remote house in the countryside, but inside find only his dead accomplice - identified as a South African mercenary who helped Bodnar procure diamonds. Ziva and Tony, meanwhile, discharge themselves from hospital and wheedle information out of Abby to continue investigating on the quiet, having been warned by Homeland Security to stay off the case.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: As Brenda's 40th birthday approaches, she investigates the high-profile case of a woman who was murdered at one of Los Angeles' trendiest restaurants. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The body of a woman is found in Provenza's garage, forcing Brenda to become involved in a cover-up of her own. The detective struggles to protect members of her team, who find themselves racing against the clock before the LAPD finds out what they are up to. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A magazine publisher is killed by a car bomb after he demands to meet a disabled girl he has been supporting. Goren and Eames begin to suspect the girl in question does not even exist and that her foster parents are running an elaborate fraud. Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A stockbroker discovers unsettling information about a company trading in land and water rights, and later becomes the prime suspect in the murder of her lover. However, evidence emerges that the crime is part of a scheme to manipulate share prices.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A cook from a US Navy destroyer tells McGee and Gibbs he believes someone is stalking him with the intention of trying to make him poison the crew, and a picture on a stolen phone leads the team to a group testing the psychological effects of surveillance. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons from the Inspector General's office closes in on Ziva as he investigates the death of Ilan Bodnar, the man who killed her father. Guest starring Colin Hanks (Gus Grimly in the Fargo TV series).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when Navy Seal Chad McBride's wife receives a package from Riyadh in Saudi Arabia containing her husband's severed head, which Palmer discovers contains very high levels of radiation. McBride's commanding officer reveals the soldier was on a top-secret reconnaissance mission and asks Vance not to disclose the details to anyone. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Palmer faces a dilemma during a hit-and-run investigation when he spots a stranger standing on a ledge, and places his own life in peril in an attempt to get the man down to safety.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The wife of a man who Danny helped to convict for manslaughter arrives at the TAC offices with a bomb, and takes the team hostage to force Bull to prove her husband's innocence.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The residents of Quahog are invited to spend an evening at James Woods' mansion, but guests start turning up dead, transforming the event into a murder mystery, with everyone struggling to identify the killer among them.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan and Francine argue over how to redecorate their home, and end up splitting the house down the middle and trying to live without each other - but the plan leads to disaster for the whole family.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian learns Rush Limbaugh has arranged a book signing at the Quahog Mall, and decides to attend the event to give the outspoken radio talk-show host a piece of his mind. However, when Rush unexpectedly comes to his rescue, the liberal-thinking dog has a political change of heart.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers that Lois's dad Carter is having an affair and is forced to keep the dalliance a secret, but causes embarrassment by accidentally revealing the truth. In the aftermath, Lois's mother demands a divorce and Peter finds himself helping Carter adjust to life as a bachelor.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine gets a job at Stan's office, which leaves him unable to flirt with his co-workers - and to make matters even worse, jealousy leads to an awful encounter.(n)

programme.title: The Walking Dead
programme.sub-title: The First Day of the Rest of Your Life.
programme.desc: The stakes mount ever higher as Rick and his fellow Alexandrians continue to enact their intricate plan to overthrow their oppressors. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mr Pickles
programme.desc: Grandpa wakes up with a horrendous hangover, and soon finds out that he made a horrible mistake the night before.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Snot is rejected after professing his love for Hayley, so Roger decides to give him a new love interest - by pretending to be Steve's female cousin. Meanwhile, Stan tries to live like a gentleman of the 1960s, complete with dark suits and dry martinis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad

programme.desc: Michael is granted permission to visit Fiona, but before he arrives she needs to find out who is trying to kill her. She goes to the prison's black-market dealer to glean some information, but it doesn't come cheap. Meanwhile, Pearce receives a file from Anson Fullerton, containing the location of Ahmed Damour - the man who murdered her asset in 2003.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of a paparazzo, who appears to have killed himself by jumping out of a hotel window. They discover a popular celebrity may have been the target of the photographer's prying camera. Meanwhile, calls from a female colleague to Fritz stir up feelings of jealousy in Brenda. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The dismembered body parts of an adult-film star are found in a skip, prompting Brenda and the team to look for more clues to solve the puzzle. However, once they begin gathering the evidence, the suspect list gets increasingly longer. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren and Eames' investigation into the murder of an undertaker leads them to discover a field of decomposed corpses. The detectives soon turn their attentions to the owner of a nearby crematorium and his shady relationship with a contract killer. Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A social services worker and a deputy mayor are murdered, and the detectives discover a link to a 10-year-old mathematics prodigy and his obsessive, pushy father. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio, with Kathryn Erbe.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American crime drama returns with the team still reeling from the Department of Defence investigation, with Ziva, McGee and Tony having handed in their badges. Parsons continues his inquiries into Gibbs and his agents, but events take a turn when an explosion kills the Secretary of the US Navy and seriously injures the director of Homeland Security. When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. She expects the group's next target to be billionaire Tomas Mendez, who spends his money trying to defeat terrorism, but whose motives may not be entirely altruistic. Meanwhile, Tony flies to Tel Aviv, where new Mossad director Orli Elbaz reveals they have a report of a possible sighting of Ziva at a kibbutz she went to as a child. Crime drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis.(n)

programme.title: 24: Legacy
programme.desc: As Mullins and CTU try and track down Carter, Andy is forced to do something that leaves him battling his own conscience. Meanwhile, Donovan questions Rebecca's judgment.(n)

programme.title: Legion
programme.desc: The superhero thriller, starring Dan Stevens as troubled mutant David Haller, draws to a close with him facing his biggest challenge yet.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Halloween arrives, and Peter joins forces with Joe to play a series of painful pranks on his friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Brian teaches Stewie the basics of trick-or-treating, and Meg has high hopes for her first festively themed high-school party.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter receives tickets to a boxing match as a birthday gift, and ends up volunteering Lois to compete. To everyone's surprise, she proves to be a natural pugilist, prompting her hapless husband to become her fight promoter - little suspecting that she is using her marital frustrations as motivation in the ring.(n)

programme.desc: Yann Martel's ponderous adventure novel gets the big-screen treatment with this Fox 2000 adaptation helmed by director Ang Lee. Paul and Jamie Buchman (Paul Reiser, Helen Hunt) will renew their wedding vows before the episode is over, but first Paul must be rushed to the hospital for an emergency tonsillectomy. Jean Louisa Kelly makes her first series appearance as Diane, an attractive nurse whose tender ministrations to Paul arouse Jamie's jealous ire. And by the way, baby Mabel utters her first word(n)

programme.title: Mad About You

programme.desc: Charlie and the Psychic Therapist. Charlie and Jordan attempt to expose a therapist(n)

programme.title: Raising Hope
programme.desc: Mrs. Smartypants. Hope's early signs of above-average intelligence inspire Jimmy to return to school to take the high-school equivalency exam, but the GED class instructor turns out to be the teacher who used to torment him. Meanwhile, Virginia and Burt follow in Jimmy's footsteps lest their son become the smartest member of the family(n)

programme.title: Raising Hope
programme.desc: Gambling Again. Burt becomes obsessed with gambling when he believes he can reclaim all the items he lost when he bet away all the Chance's belongings nearly 20 years ago. Worried about his bad habit re-emerging, Virginia and Jimmy try to intervene but soon get swept up in the betting frenzy and develop their own gambling habit. But their luck begins to run out when they miss Shelley's staged play written by Sabrina and starring Hope as the lead(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Are You Better Off?. Elswhere, Jamie (Helen Hunt) is reinvigorated and Paul (Paul Reiser) is worn out by a noontime sex session(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Gin It Up!. Leslie tries to be a voice of reason when a minor scandal gets blown out of proportion, while Tom attempts to wow a love interest, and Ben strongly encourages Ron to prepare his last will and testament(n)

programme.desc: Filibuster. Leslie is forced to leave the birthday party she's throwing for Ben and attend an emergency late-night filibuster. Meanwhile, Tom is determined to make some lasting memories with his new girlfriend; Ron and Donna go hunting; and April and Andy reconnect(n)

programme.title: Marvel's The Avengers
programme.desc: Marvel Studios delivers the ultimate comic-book film, which ties together such characters as Iron Man (Robert Downey Jr.), Captain America (Chris Evans), The Hulk (Mark Ruffalo), and Thor (Chris Hemsworth) for a big-screen franchise team-up like no other. Taking center stage this time is Nick Fury (played once again by the note-perfect Samuel L. Jackson), leader of the peacekeeping agency known as S.H.I.E.L.D. Fury, along with former Russian spy Black Widow (Scarlett Johansson), recruits a super team to combat Thor's ever-deceptive brother Loki (Tom Hiddleston) after he brainwashes ace archer Hawkeye (Jeremy Renner) while stealing a cosmic cube from an underground base. Thus the heroes must learn to work together alongside outlaw scientist Bruce Banner (Ruffalo), who can track down the artifact's gamma signals when he's not hulking out into a giant green monster. Show runner Joss Whedon (Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Firefly) adapted and helmed the script by Zak Penn(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Archer Dreamland: No Good Deed. In the eighth season premiere, Archer tries to find out who killed his partner, but accidentally gets in bed with Mother, a notorious L.A. crime boss(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Deadly Velvet: Part II. Conclusion. In the seventh season finale, someone is killed on the movie set(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Archer Dreamland: No Good Deed. In the eighth season premiere, Archer tries to find out who killed his partner, but accidentally gets in bed with Mother, a notorious L.A. crime boss(n)

programme.title: Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa
programme.desc: An elderly man takes his grandson on a decadent road trip across the United States in this sidesplitting hidden-camera comedy(n)

programme.title: Down to the Sea in Ships
programme.desc: Sea captain Bering Joy takes his grandson Jed on a whaling trip to teach him about life's challenges and truths, while first mate Dan Lunceford's assignment to look after the lad has dramatic consequences on a voyage packed with incident and danger. Seafaring adventure, starring Lionel Barrymore, Richard Widmark, and Dean Stockwell.(n)

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: A man wrongly accused of murder flees from the authorities to start a new life in a Mexican border town. He ends up helping the local sheriff deal with a corrupt rancher's crooked schemes, while falling for the lawman's sister. However, his new-found happiness is threatened when his face starts to appear on wanted posters. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Lin McCarthy, Alan Baxter and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush.(n)

programme.title: Comanche
programme.desc: A powerful Native American chief agrees to take part in peace talks with Washington after an encounter with a sympathetic scout. However, a group of renegade warriors are unwilling to surrender their arms and their actions prompt a bigoted government official to use brutal methods. Western, starring Dana Andrews, Kent Smith, Nestor Paiva and Henry Brandon.(n)

programme.title: Admission
programme.desc: A by-the-book university admissions officer visits an unconventional school run by a former college friend to interview a gifted student. She begins to suspect the pupil may be the son she gave up for adoption, and the experience makes her rethink her uncompromising outlook on life. Comedy drama, with Tina Fey and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic soldier uses technology that allows him to control a genetically engineered body on a mission to a dangerous jungle world. His assignment is to infiltrate an alien tribe on behalf of a corrupt mining corporation, which wants to drive them from their land. He comes to sympathise with the natives, and helps them fight back against his employers. James Cameron's sci-fi adventure, starring Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang.(n)

programme.title: Andrei Rublev
programme.desc: Andrei Tarkovsky's acclaimed historical drama chronicling the life of the 15th-century monk, icon painter and political activist, who leaves his monastery to travel to Moscow and witnesses an incident that causes him to take a vow of silence and renounce painting for more than a decade. Starring Anatoliy Solonitsyn and Ivan Lapikov. In Russian.(n)

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wealthy and ambitious cattleman plans to seize all the land surrounding his own. A peaceful rancher living nearby ignores warnings to sell up and avoid a conflict, and as he suffers a campaign of intimidation, he is forced to adopt violent methods to defend his livelihood. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew.(n)

programme.title: Bitter Victory
programme.desc: Two British officers are assigned to lead a raid on a German stronghold in Libya and steal secret documents. However, one of the pair suspects the other of having had an affair with his wife and the tension between them threatens the mission. Second World War drama, starring Richard Burton, Curt Jurgens, Ruth Roman and Christopher Lee.(n)

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: Withdrawn, mute 10-year-old Philip is ignored by his parents and goes off to explore Dartmoor alone, where he meets a retired colonel who shares his knowledge of Devon's wildlife. Under the older man's nurturing tutelage, the boy begins to tame a wild white colt, but fate proffers a series of setbacks just as real progress is being made. Children's drama, starring John Mills, Mark Lester, Sylvia Syms and Bernard Miles.(n)

programme.title: My Darling Clementine
programme.desc: Retired lawman Wyatt Earp accepts the post of Tombstone city marshal when one of his brothers is killed by cattle rustlers, and embarks on a crusade to bring his murderers to justice and drive lawlessness from the streets. Western, directed by John Ford, starring Henry Fonda, Victor Mature, Linda Darnell and Walter Brennan.(n)

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: An expedition to find King Solomon's diamond mines in the jungles of the Congo disappears without trace. The tycoon behind the mission sends his assistant, a former CIA agent, to find out what became of the explorers - only to discover that the party met a grisly fate at the hands of a horde of vicious apes. Action adventure based on Michael Crichton's novel, with Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Tim Curry and Grant Heslov.(n)

programme.title: Ride Along
programme.desc: A wannabe police officer persuades his girlfriend's tough detective brother to take him along on duty. The cop hopes to scare his unwanted partner away from his sister by exposing him to danger - but needs some help when the patrol leads to a run-in with the city's most wanted criminal. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: Chicken
programme.desc: Premiere. Fifteen-year-old Richard has learning difficulties and lives a lonely, introverted life with his older brother Polly in a dilapidated caravan on a farm where they are squatting. When new owners take possession of the land, their presence brings excitement and hope for Richard, as he starts to develop a relationship with their 17-year-old daughter Annabel, but the new dynamic also provokes far darker consequences. Coming-of-age drama, starring Scott Chambers, Morgan Watkins and Yasmin Paige.(n)

programme.desc: The cook creates fridge-friendly food, including truffle mac and cheese.(n)

In the first edition, Paul heads to New York, where he discovers how doughnuts have been recreated with fresh, innovative flavours. Plus, he meets internet sensation Jim Lahey, who has invented a new, simple way of baking bread at home.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Food writer and chef Ching-He Huang assists two personal trainers who want to win their friends' approval with a couple of spicy suppers. On the menu are chilli chicken and cashew nuts, and chilli bean cod with an exotic mushroom stir-fry.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes

Among the dishes highlighted are fried sweet chilli chicken, spicy Sichuan aubergine and griddled yellow-bean pork.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: With his campaign drawing to a close, Jamie Oliver is unsure the lessons he has taught to the people of Rotherham will stick after his departure. With this in mind, he approaches the local council in the hope that it will encourage the population to continue living healthily. He also organises a series of Pass It On street parties, culminating in a bash for the entire town. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and her sister-in-law throw an engagement do for her friend, with appetisers and prime rib on the menu. Plus, there are glasses of fizz to toast the future Mr and Mrs.(n)

programme.desc: Two carpenters hope to swap their hammers for woks and learn to make quick and easy oriental dishes, so cook Ching-He Huang teaches them how to prepare noodle-based dishes, including rice wine and peppered beef, Taiwanese ginger and sesame chicken, and mixed seafood.(n)

They also search for ways to make their lifestyles more active - including swapping their beloved motorbikes for pedal-powered machines - and learn why obesity is an increasingly serious problem in 21st-century Britain.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Two carpenters hope to swap their hammers for woks and learn to make quick and easy oriental dishes, so cook Ching-He Huang teaches them how to prepare noodle-based dishes, including rice wine and peppered beef, Taiwanese ginger and sesame chicken, and mixed seafood.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang heads for London to lend her expertise to two American entrepreneurs keen to enjoy a diverse diet, but struggling to fit time in the kitchen into their busy lives. She teaches them how to prepare spicy chunky lamb, pork and water chestnut dumplings and duck spring rolls.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers embark on a quest to lose weight while still enjoying the food they love by creating healthier versions of their favourite recipes. They also search for ways to make their lifestyles more active - including swapping their beloved motorbikes for pedal-powered machines - and learn why obesity is an increasingly serious problem in 21st-century Britain.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes roasted lemon chicken legs, Mexican macaroni salad, watermelon pico de gallo and brown sugar oatmeal cookies for a pet parade and potluck pinic.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes her favourite comfort food, including chicken and dumplings, quesadillas with shrimp and peppers, pasta with tomato cream sauce and cinnamon toast.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang introduces two surveyors to a variety of new flavours, taking them to London's Chinatown to browse the spice markets. She also demonstrates how to prepare red-cooked fish, crispy Mongolian lamb and Cantonese-style duck with pak choi and rice.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang takes two taxi drivers to London's Chinatown, where she demonstrates the wide variety of chilli-based products available on the market. She then teaches them how to cook tiger prawns with shiitake mushrooms and rice wine, and a Chinese take on fish and chips.(n)

programme.title: Spring Baking Championship
programme.desc: In the final episode, the three remaining bakers must create a wedding cake in order to become the Spring Baking Champion.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their dietary challenge by reinventing favourite family meals. They prepare a cooked breakfast that delivers all the excitement of a fry-up without adding to the waistline, and a calorie-conscious roast chicken dinner. They also rework French classic the cassoulet and set it before a couple of famished rugby teams, and make the ultimate sacrifice in a bid to help shift the pounds - give up their beloved motorbikes in favour of bicycles.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri travels to Los Angeles to visits a food truck infusing Singaporean flavours into chilli crab cakes and lamb burgers.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri travels up and down America's west coast searching for cool neighbourhood spots. He arrives in San Diego where a restaurant serves up a creme brulee French toast.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel is called in to Sonrisa Grill to help the once lively Mexican restaurant. The owner, Chanthy, has borrowed from relatives to keep the suffering grill alive.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel discovers a restaurant with undisciplined staff that treat a restaurant like their living room and drive customers away with their rude and inappropriate behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Danny and Jonathan, owners of the Old School Bar and Grill in Texas, are concerned about a loss of revenue on their poetry nights, so Charles sends in Justin and Samantha to investigate the causes of the reduction.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Carl, owner of the Bakehouse Restaurant and Bar in Austin, Texas, fears a dispute between his son and his favourite waitress is threatening the harmony of his establishment, so seeks the team's advice on the best way to proceed.(n)

programme.desc: Foggy tries to defy his age by entering the annual barrel-rolling competition, and undergoes a gruelling training programme. Meanwhile, Pearl buys Howard a tropical fish tank as a gift. Long-running rural comedy, starring Brian Wilde and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The wily trio set about trying to find a new home for Smiler, whose wife has left him after 33 years of marriage and gone to live with her sister in Australia.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo is very upset to learn that that Nora Batty has taken Smiler as a lodger, so Foggy attempts to distract him from his depression by indulging in a spot of dancing. Brian Wilde and Bill Owen star.(n)

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads
programme.desc: Terry arrives home from the Army to find his parents on holiday, the fridge empty, the house cold and Thelma her usual unhelpful self. Luckily Bob is on hand with a suggestion. Comedy, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes, with Brigit Forsyth.(n)

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads begin work on dismantling the historic Transporter Bridge, but tension between the Serbian and Kosovan workers soon starts slowing things down - and worries about Bomber's health add to their woes. Elsewhere, Mickey Startup dispatches hitman Teddy Platt to teach Moxey the error of his ways, while Oz has an eye-opening reunion with son Rod. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's popular comic drama, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo thinks that he hears Nora Batty happily singing so he obsessively spies on her imagining that she is having a romance with her lodger, Smiler. Bill Owen stars.(n)

programme.desc: Compo thinks he is about to come into a fortune when he remembers someone owes him money from his schooldays.(n)

programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney and Mickey Pearce are commissioned to make a community film, but Del-Boy soon gets in on the act, offering a role to anyone who wants one - provided they pay for the privilege.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?.
programme.desc: An old friend returns from Australia flushed with success and offers Del a share in his business empire Down Under. Although the prospect is tempting, it would mean leaving Nelson Mandela House and little brother Rodney behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy becomes a yuppie, complete with red braces, Filofax and chrome briefcase. Meanwhile, Rodney begins attending a computer course at night school, where he meets Cassandra. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney dates an artist who turns out to be the daughter of the Duke of Maylebury. Del sees the chance for the Trotter family to marry into the aristocracy, and disastrously gatecrashes a party at the Duke's country estate. Christmas special from 1986, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.desc: Richard Madeley and Judy Finnigan make guest appearances, as Lou qualifies for phone quiz You Say, We Pay. programme.desc: The comedy duo pay tongue-in-cheek tribute to Fleetwood Mac, discuss Jerry Hall and star in a parody of In Bed with Madonna.(n)

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: Ria decides that she should do something worthwhile with her life and goes for a job. However, husband Ben is not supportive. Wendy Craig stars.(n)

programme.title: Sorry

programme.desc: Lionel finally reaches the end of his tether with busybody secretary Mrs Flack - so Jean hatches a cunning plan to ease her out without causing a scene. Comedy, starring Judi Dench, Geoffrey Palmer and Vivienne Martin.(n)

programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.(n)

programme.title: Henry IX
programme.desc: New series. Comedy starring Charles Edwards as a king who has a crisis of confidence and tries to modernise the monarchy - despite the objections of his family. With Sally Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Comedy featuring a British Pakistani family, set in Sparkhill, Birmingham. Plans for daughter Shazia's forthcoming wedding to Amjad are thrown into disarray when Mr Khan forgets to book a venue, much to his wife's displeasure. The self-opinionated patriarch isn't too concerned though, he's confident that he can persuade mosque manager Dave to do him a favour - but his long-suffering nearest and dearest know from experience that nothing is ever straightforward when father's involved. Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia star, with Kris Marshall and Abdullah Afzal.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan's mother comes to stay, jeopardising Mr Khan's big opportunity to hob-nob with the bigwigs of Sparkhill Business Association when he has to take the old woman on a shopping trip. Comedy about the trials and tribulations of a British Pakistani family, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Roman's facial gets out of hand when estranged wife Bubbles interferes, and Dudley is shocked by Ting Tong's latest revelations, but cannot resist her tight green outfit. programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Low & Slow, Casa Manila, Charlie the Butcher.
programme.desc: ohn Catucci learns the secret to great barbecue in Sault St Marie, Ontario, and in Toronto, he discovers the international flavours of Phillipine cooking at Casa Manila.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Prohibition Montreal, Battista's Calzone Co, Burgers N' Fries Forever.
programme.desc: John Catucci has brunch at Montreal's Prohibition, then tries the specialty at Battista's Calzone Co in Edmonton, before visiting Burgers 'n' Fries Forever in Ottawa.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The six remaining contestants head for Sarre Windmill in Kent for the third round of the competition. Here, they are challenged to bake the perfect loaf, under the watchful eyes of Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Meanwhile, Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins taste Britain's earliest bread roll and discover the hidden history of the sandwich.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first two semi-finalists are challenged to work a shift at the two Michelin-starred Dinner by Heston Blumenthal restaurant in Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park hotel in Knightsbridge, central London. Head chef Ashley Palmer-Watts then asks them to make salamugundy - a salad of chicken oysters, roasted salsify, bone marrow and horseradish - which is one of the establishment's signature dishes. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti, who pick one to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the impact of Britain's colonial past on the nation's food, making a bread and butter pudding with chai and adding Indian pale ale to a sausage casserole. They also investigate the origins of gin and tonic and a brand of Worcester sauce, both of which arose from the UK's imperial past.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: Master baker Paul Hollywood shares secrets on how to create breads from all over the world, demonstrating mouthwatering recipes to transform this staple food into an array of delicious dishes. In the first episode, he explores the history and traditional flavours of great British bread and reveals how to make some of the country's favourites, including the classic white bloomer, a crusty everyday bread, a honey-glazed fruit malt loaf and the ultimate ploughman's loaf. Plus, Paul creates a medieval style rye and wholemeal trencher which serves as the centrepiece to a hearty family dinner.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: Chef James Martin embarks on a road trip along the east coast of the USA to discover the best cakes, buns and fabulous bakes. He begins by trying a classic apple pie in Virginia, before he discovers the New Orleans king cake in a southern bakery.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka.(n)

programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The six remaining contestants head for Sarre Windmill in Kent for the third round of the competition. Here, they are challenged to bake the perfect loaf, under the watchful eyes of Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Meanwhile, Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins taste Britain's earliest bread roll and discover the hidden history of the sandwich.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first two semi-finalists are challenged to work a shift at the two Michelin-starred Dinner by Heston Blumenthal restaurant in Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park hotel in Knightsbridge, central London. Head chef Ashley Palmer-Watts then asks them to make salamugundy - a salad of chicken oysters, roasted salsify, bone marrow and horseradish - which is one of the establishment's signature dishes. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti, who pick one to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the impact of Britain's colonial past on the nation's food, making a bread and butter pudding with chai and adding Indian pale ale to a sausage casserole. They also investigate the origins of gin and tonic and a brand of Worcester sauce, both of which arose from the UK's imperial past.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: Master baker Paul Hollywood shares secrets on how to create breads from all over the world, demonstrating mouthwatering recipes to transform this staple food into an array of delicious dishes. In the first episode, he explores the history and traditional flavours of great British bread and reveals how to make some of the country's favourites, including the classic white bloomer, a crusty everyday bread, a honey-glazed fruit malt loaf and the ultimate ploughman's loaf. Plus, Paul creates a medieval style rye and wholemeal trencher which serves as the centrepiece to a hearty family dinner.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.desc: John Catucci samples Mexican rotisserie at Rostizado in Edmonton, and has `the cutest breakfast ever' at Ottawa's Wilf & Ada's.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: The Hogtown Cure, Son of a Peach, Belle Isle Seafood.
programme.desc: John Catucci learns why Toronto earns its nickname at the Hogtown Cure, and in Burlington, Ontario, enjoys a few home comforts at pizza-burger joint Son of a Peach.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The five remaining contestants head for Bakewell in Derbyshire, where they are challenged to reinvent classics such as peach and blueberry, sticky toffee, and rhubarb and orange Betty puddings. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins discover how the nation's favourite desserts helped change Britain's image abroad.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The next two semi-finalists work a shift at the Michelin-starred Latymer restaurant in the Pennyhill Park Hotel in Bagshot, Surrey. The pair must recreate head chef Michael Wignall's signature dish of quail breast with confit quail leg, braised tongue, sweetbreads and cockscomb in a port glaze. They then draw on what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Gregg Wallace, with only one contestant progressing to the final round.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the links between American and British culinary cultures. They make clam chowder and chocolate brownies, before visiting London's Savoy hotel to discuss the history of the cocktail and reveal how the farmers' market is one of the UK's favourite imports from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: The master baker explores the diverse and colourful world of flatbreads, making corn tortillas served stacked and layered with spicy roast chicken, guacamole and sour cream. Paul also bakes a Middle Eastern maneesh to dip in a smoky baba ganoush, tries his hand at making traditional wafer-thin Indian lentil dosas and gets to grips with a supersize Caribbean roti known as `buss up shot'. He shares his love of Cypriot food with a recipe for nigella-scented pittas stuffed with pork souvlaki.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: Chef James Martin's culinary journey to discover the best cakes, buns and fabulous bakes in America continues with an exploration of the country's passion for cupcakes and a sample of the state dessert of Maryland.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi.(n)

programme.title: Unguarded
programme.desc: A production of ESPN Films, this sports documentary from director Jonathan Hock profiles Chris Herren, an athlete with a spectacular rise and a tragic fall. A native of Fall River, Massachusetts, Herren performed so remarkably as a high school varsity basketball player that he attained legendary status even before he graduated from 12th grade. His success continued through his undergraduate enrollment at Fresno State, and ultimately enabled him to make the cut for the Boston Celtics, but at about the same time, Herren developed a serious drug addiction that cost him his place in the pros and literally almost killed him. Though he survived, just barely, his story continues to sound a cautionary note to others who may find themselves in similar positions(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

programme.title: Max
programme.desc: A military dog from Afghanistan is adopted by his late handler's grieving family in the U.S., where his close bond with the soldier's brother leads to a life-altering revelation in this family-friendly adventure from MGM and director Boaz Yakin (who penned the screenplay alongside writer Sheldon Lettich)(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: An estranged husband-and-wife treasure hunting team decide to patch up their differences when news breaks of a potentially massive haul of booty on an old shipwreck on an island off the Florida coast. However, the murderous gangster rapper who owns the isle has brought in a rival bounty hunter, forcing the pair to battle against time - and their marital difficulties - if they are to reach the golden galleon(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: Anthony Minghella's multi-Oscar-winning story of love, mystery, betrayal, honour and adventure brings together disparate plot strands, times and characters. Nurse Juliette Binoche, accompanying the Allied advance in Italy, sets up a hospital in a monastery to nurse the dying, burned and disfigured Ralph Fiennes. Seeming to have lost his memory, flashes return with the arrival of the enigmatic Willem Dafoe and his past in the Sahara as an archaeologist and his affair with married Kristin Scott Thomas are revealed. Subtitles(n)

programme.desc: Classic cult comedy following the adventures of a Los Angeles hippie who, after being mistaken for a wealthy industrialist, becomes involved in an outlandish extortion scheme(n)

programme.desc: Danny Boyle's cult low budget horror stars Cillian Murphy as one of those unaffected by a plague which has turned most of humanity into blood-crazed zombies. As he and a growing band of survivors group together in London and try to reach the military stronghold commanded by Chris Eccleston in Manchester, they face the most dangerous journey of their lives..(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In this survival tale based on a true story, a 19th century frontiersman is left for dead after being attacked by his comrades, only to survive and claim his revenge(n)

programme.title: One Missed Call
programme.desc: Shannyn Sossamon and Ed Burns star in director Eric Valette's remake of Takashi Miike's frightful tale about a cell-phone call from the future that foreshadows one's own death. Beth Raymond (Sossamon) is a college student whose friends have all been dying in droves, and the one connecting factor between all of the incidents is that just before their deaths, each of the victims received a message in which they heard themselves being murdered. Upon receiving her own frightening phone call, Beth has only three days to solve the mystery and cheat death. Burns co-stars as a detective who is deeply troubled by the recent spate of deaths(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Collision Course
programme.desc: Scrat's epic pursuit of the elusive acorn catapults him into the universe where he accidentally sets off a series of cosmic events that transform and threaten the Ice Age World(n)

programme.title: Joe Somebody
programme.desc: Tim Allen, Patrick Warburton and Julie Bowen star in John Pasquin's comedy-drama about a man whose life is changed by a bullying incident. Mild-mannered Joe Scheffer is taking his pre-teen daughter Natalie to a corporate event at his big pharma workplace when an argument over a parking space results in Joe being set upon by a colleague Mark McKinney. The incident destroys Joe's confidence and he sinks into a depression that keeps him away from work. But his life is set to change when the company's 'wellness co-ordinator', Meg Harper, pays him a visit. There's immediate mutual attraction, but something she says to Joe also inadvertently sparks a desire for revenge in him. It's not long before he's training with Chuck Scarett, a former martial arts film star; and - back at work - his new, assertive persona is winning him legions of friends. But not everyone is impressed - Natalie and Meg preferred him as he was..(n)

programme.title: 2 Days: Vasyl Lomachenko
programme.desc: A 48-hour visit with junior-lightweight boxer Vasyl Lomachenko(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Exhilarating biopic of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens (Stephan James) and his inspiring journey to overcome racism at home and abroad, culminating in his triumphant track and field performance at the 1936 Berlin Olympics under the tutelage of gruff Ohio State coach Larry Snyder (Jason Sudeikis) and the skeptical gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Zookeeper's Wife'
programme.desc: A look at "The Zookeeper's Wife," a 2017 drama based on Diane Ackerman's nonfiction book about a couple who used the Warsaw Zoo to save hundreds of Jews during the German occupation of Poland during World War II. The film stars Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Brühl, and is directed by Niki Caro(n)

programme.title: Hitman
programme.desc: A gun-for-hire known only as Agent 47 hired by a group known only as 'The Organization' is ensnared in a political conspiracy(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: Tris and Four journey beyond the wall surrounding Chicago, and get caught up in a battle for the fate of humanity(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: The hilarious hit comedy in which Marisa Tomei won an Oscar for her dazzling performance as Lisa, the girlfriend of Joe Pesci's loser lawyer Vinny. Unfortunately his first case just happens to involve his young cousin Ralph Macchio, who has been wrongly accused of the murder of a shop assistant. Down in Alabama for the trial, it's up to Vinny to save the day with a dynamite performance (provided that he can stay awake in court for long enough) - and hang on to Lisa as their relationship hits the rocks(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, a bumbling private eye and an enforcer-for-hire team up to find a missing woman with ties to the porn industry. In time, their sleuthing reveals a far-reaching conspiracy involving corruption in the federal government(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Gifted'
programme.desc: A look at "Gifted," a 2017 drama about a man doing his best to raise his 7-year-old niece, whose emergence as a math prodigy leads to a custody battle between the man and his mother. The film stars Chris Evans, Mckenna Grace and Lindsay Duncan, and is directed Marc Webb(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: In a side-splitting film that brings together some of comedy's sharpest talent, 30 Rock star Tina Fey, Amy Poehler and writer/director Michael McCullers join forces to tell the story of two women, one apartment and the nine months that will change their lives. The always winning and wry Fey portrays a focused and driven New York career woman who desperately wants a baby but is physically unable to carry the child herself. Undaunted, she recruits a South Philly working girl (Poehler) to act as her surrogate. Everything goes according to plan until a pregnant Poehler shows up on Fey's doorstep with no place to live, and suddenly two very different women are joined together to create a very unexpected family(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Michelle Darnell is a successful businesswoman who is sent to prison after being convicted of insider trading. She tries to start over after being released, but not everyone is ready to forgive and forget(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbor troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door in this hysterical comedy sequel. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: The Devil Wears Prada director David Frankel's light comedy-drama - based on a best-selling autobiography - stars Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston as a pair of married journalists who welcome a truly unruly dog into their lives. Relocating to Florida, newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan end up working for rival newspapers, and it's soon obvious that Jenny has landed the more high-profile job. But when she starts to become broody, one of John's colleagues suggests they see how they cope with a puppy before trying for a baby. John duly picks a cute yellow Labrador Retriever as a gift for his spouse. It's quickly clear their acquisition is something of a double-edged sword: he's an untrainably anarchic source of destruction; but he also gives John the material for a wry newspaper column, which greatly increases his standing.The film follows the trajectory of the Grogans' marriage, through good times and bad, and the stuff of everyday life, with the dog providing comic relief and the leads turning in convincing, heart-warming performances(n)

Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Employee of the Month. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

When Tiger and Joey hear about the free trip they decide that they want to get involved too, but end up being roped into being the entertainment for the park's visitors, with disastrous results.(n)

programme.desc: On the morning of September 5, 2013, 130 vehicles on the Sheppey Crossing in Kent collided in thick fog. In the chaos that followed, more than 300 people found themselves trapped amidst a sea of crumpled and twisted metal and broken glass. This drama-documentary focuses on the personal stories of some of the people caught up in one of the biggest pile-ups seen on British roads.(n)

Meanwhile, the Aidensfield police officers are baffled by the activities of a modern-day Robin Hood, who has committed a string of burglaries and given away his ill-gotten gains to the elderly residents of a new block of flats. Drama, starring Derek Fowlds.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate a murder committed on the first night of a quiz weekend held at Chaucer College. Sealing the college grounds to interrogate the remaining 11 contestants, the pair discover the victim had a track record for sexual harassment involving fellow competitors, as well as past dealings with a shady engineering business funded by Russian gangsters and masterminded by Oxford professor Charles Milner - another quiz fan. With guest stars Alan Davies (QI), Timothy West (Bleak House) and Nicholas Farrell (The Iron Lady).(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost

Rob ends up a little worse for wear, but a chance meeting with a university mate ensures he doesn't go astray. Elsewhere, Kenneth and Liam have a falling out, Lesley and Mateo are intent on finding out what scam Sam is up to.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: A man wrecks a jewellery store and puts a security guard in hospital. Murtaugh delves deep into the psyche of the suspect, a former Navy Seal once treated for post traumatic stress disorder, and draws parallels between him and his partner Riggs, who also once served in the military. Although Riggs' association with the suspect threatens to interfere with the case, it also forces him to open up to his colleague about the experiences that have shaped him. Clayne Crawford, Damon Wayans and Dante Brown star.(n)

Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Damon Wayans, Chelsea Field, Halle Berry and Noble Willingham.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone

Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen star.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Lady Prudence's society friends are rehearsing their show at Bellamy House when an air raid warning sounds, forcing everyone to shelter underground. As Richard surveys his damaged property the next day, a telegram arrives with chilling news about James.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective is ordered to take a holiday for the benefit of his health, and with Hastings and Miss Lemon in tow, reluctantly heads for the tranquillity of Devon's coast, where his relaxation is soon ruined by the discovery of a socialite's murdered body on the beach. Several people had reason for wishing Arlena Stuart dead, but high on the list of suspects are her husband, teenage son and a troubled vicar. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser, Philip Jackson and Pauline Moran star.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: As the trial of local teenager Gary Bell approaches, Sidney and Geordie find themselves in disagreement regarding his guilt. Meanwhile, a man is convinced that his dead wife is haunting his home and stable yards, and implores Sidney to come to his estate and perform an exorcism for him. The vicar offers prayers and counsel, but when the man is found hanged in the exact same spot in which his wife died, Sidney and Geordie are united by a shared goal as they investigate his suicide. Drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green.(n)

programme.title: Churchill's Secret
programme.desc: Michael Gambon stars as Winston Churchill in this feature-length drama based on Jonathan Smith's novel. In 1953, a nurse (Romola Garai) is summoned to a secret location where she learns she is needed to treat the elderly prime minister, who has suffered a stroke and is not expected to survive. She bears witness as Churchill's family gather by his bedside preparing for the worst, and sees the long-buried tensions between them rising to the surface. Also starring Lindsay Duncan, Bill Paterson and Tara Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.desc: Drama detailing the stories of the people of London during the Great Fire of 1666. Widower and single father Thomas Farriner is the king's baker, currently providing the Navy with bread and biscuits from his Pudding Lane bakery. His sister-in-law Sarah often helps out at the shop - a distraction from the fact her wayward husband (Thomas's brother) has been missing at sea for months now. Thomas is dismayed to learn from Navy official Samuel Pepys that it's unlikely he'll be paid for his latest job, owing to the expense of the war against the Dutch. However, he instead sends the baker away with a letter that could be the key to Sarah's closure. Meanwhile, in the palace of Whitehall, the king attends a stately dance, where an attempt on his life is foiled. Later, Thomas returns to find the bakery ablaze, with his two daughters asleep upstairs. Starring Andrew Buchan, Rose Leslie and Jack Huston.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.desc: Thomas bursts into his sister-in-law's lodgings to wake his family and lead them to safety, but Sarah is nowhere to be seen. Held in a private cell at Newgate Prison, she's waiting to be interrogated by Lord Denton about a possible Catholic plot against the king. Meanwhile, Samuel brings news of the rapidly spreading blaze to Charles, who surveys the damage from the safety of the river. From this vantage point, the monarch is shocked into action, ordering his advisers to compensate the public and tear down buildings to create firebreaks, but Hyde and Ashley-Cooper have other ideas.(n)

Back in the UK, Bobby, Nina and Alec face a race against time as they try to locate the pages at the heart of the case. programme.desc: So-called Internet Casanova Ray Holycross, who `preyed'' on women online and broke dozens of hearts across state lines. He also stole money and belongings from his victims.(n)

programme.title: Deadline: Crime with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: The journalist investigates two cases, reflecting on how a lucky tip proved invaluable in solving the case of a career woman murdered on her daily walk and how the fate of a kidnapped California girl relied upon the help of strangers.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Carla Fuqua, who vanished after a night out with friends in October 2009. A dedicated mother, it was known that the 28-year-old would never leave her son behind. More alarmingly, Carla became the fourth missing person in a town of less than 5,000. Her remains were found three years later in a wooded area in Alabama, but eventually ker kiiller was caught.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of nursing student Michelle Le, whose body was found in a remote Californian canyon four months after she disappeared in May 2011. Giselle Esteban was later found guilty of murdering the 26-year-old after she became jealous of her relationship Le had with the father of her child.(n)

programme.title: Who Killed Jane Doe
programme.desc: The case of Pamela Knight, who in 2005 vanished on her youngest son's birthday. Seven years later, two men found her remains buried under an abandoned shed. It transpired her husband, Paul Anthony Knight, had killed her and hidden her body before disappearing himself.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: New series. A case in which a mother and Bible teacher went missing from her family's farm. Investigators in Missouri had to decipher a cryptic handwritten note, while a walk in nearby woods uncovered a mysterious skull.(n)

programme.title: Forbidden: Dying for Love
programme.desc: A case that began when a high-flying attorney and one of his clients began an illicit affair. His infatuation led to obsession and when their adulterous relationship was revealed, the laws of attraction proved fatal.(n)

programme.title: Grave Secrets
programme.desc: The murder of cocktail waitress Shauna Tiaffay in September 2012. Her husband George became the prime suspect, though he had an alibi. It later transpired he had hired homeless man Noel Stevens to carry out the act.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: New series. A case in which a mother and Bible teacher went missing from her family's farm. Investigators in Missouri had to decipher a cryptic handwritten note, while a walk in nearby woods uncovered a mysterious skull.(n)

programme.title: Forbidden: Dying for Love
programme.desc: A case that began when a high-flying attorney and one of his clients began an illicit affair. His infatuation led to obsession and when their adulterous relationship was revealed, the laws of attraction proved fatal.(n)

programme.title: Your Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: The murder of 25-year-old student Sandy Jeffers, who died after Aaron Skeen broke into her Tennessee home and assaulted her. Skeen was arrested and charged in May 2003, four days after Jeffers disappeared. He led officers to her body below an observation point along the Foothills Parkway in the Smoky Mountains.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 22-year-old Jamie Fraley, who vanished from her North Carolina apartment in April 2008. Her keys and purse were found locked inside her apartment and there were no signs of foul play. Officers considered whether her boyfriend's father could be involved, after it emerged that he harboured a dark obsession with her.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators assess conflicting accounts of an office party that took a violent turn and left one woman injured.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Complaints about a mistreated boxer dog lead investigators to a repeat animal abuser, and the officers decide to press charges.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Officers catch three boys training a pit bull to fight by using a puppy as bait, and further investigation leads to more evidence of animal abuse.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Bethany Decker, a National Guardsman's wife, who vanished while pregnant with her second child as her husband completed a tour of service in Afghanistan. Police discovered the 21-year-old's life was far more complicated than anyone realised.(n)

programme.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: The legal battle that followed the 1993 death of country music singer Conway Twitty, who left an estate valued at $15million.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Insight into the manhunt for tracker Claude Dallas, who shot two sheriffs dead before disappearing into the mountains of Idaho. Knowing Dallas could stay hidden indefinitely, the FBI were forced to employ unique tactics and set up a modern-day posse to track him down.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The presenter revisits the case of Detroit brothers Tommy and Ray Highers, who it is claimed, spent 25 years behind bars for a murder they did not commit.(n)

programme.desc: The case of David Pauley, who secured a ranch worker job he had seen advertised on Craigslist, before disappearing shortly afterwards.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How clues found in common substances can help investigators solve homicide cases.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from 2008, when the discovery of the bullet-riddled bodies of 11-year-old Skyla Whitaker and 13-year-old Taylor Placker sent the Oklahoma community of Weleetka into a state of panic.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Sherrill Levitt, Suzie Streeter and Stacy McCall who vanished from their home in Springfield, Missouri, in June 1992. Sherrill was Suzie's mother, while Stacy was her friend and the disappearance happened a day after Suzie and Stacy had graduated from high school.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The shotgun murders of John and Carolyn Tarwacki. Boot prints revealed the path the killer had taken, but the search for a motive led police in a startling direction.(n)

programme.desc: The case of student Kenia Monge, who disappeared without a trace. The search hit dead ends until detectives uncovered chilling surveillance footage, revealing what had befallen her.(n)

programme.desc: The case of a respected Kentucky businesswoman, found bludgeoned and stabbed to death in her home. Detectives followed a long path to pursue her killer.(n)

programme.desc: Tough Crowd. Terra makes it to the semi-finals of "Dancing With the Stars," but multiple health issues and waning support from friends increases the pressure. programme.desc: Things Fall Apart. Briana worries she might have postpartum depression; and Christy's recovery is even harder than anticipated. Later, Terra wishes she was back in the ballroom and struggles to fulfill her promises of making her family, friends and health a priority(n)

programme.desc: On Thin Ice. After a tough pregnancy, Jasmine's delivery isn't as easy as she hoped; and Briana is rushed to the hospital with severe pain. Later, Elena and Terra have not spoken to each other in over a month, but the pair go ice skating in hopes of making amends(n)

Knight) walks in. And on the "patient roster" front, a lung cancer victim (Roxanne Hart) decides to throw caution to the winds, with wide-ranging results(n)
